title: PART-TIME B CARE COORDINATOR
company: Home and Community Care Support Services Erie St....
description:
JOB POSTING

ESC 023/22

PART-TIME B CARE COORDINATOR (Multiple Opportunities)

Unionized Position – ONA

Erie St. Clair Region

(Chatham-Kent, Sarnia-Lambton and Windsor-Essex Sites)

Background:

Home and Community Care Support Services Erie St. Clair is one of 14 Home and Community Care Support Services organizations in Ontario with a focused mandate to deliver local health care services such as home and community care and long-term care home placement. Home and Community Care Support Services is dedicated to ensuring the ongoing delivery of local services while Ontario makes changes to improve the health care system to give patients better connected care with health care providers working as one coordinated team in Ontario Health Teams.

The Home and Community Care Support Services Erie St. Clair has a need for Part-Time B Care Coordinators as described below. The Home and Community Care Support Services Erie St. Clair is committed to supporting healthcare in a manner that is consistent with patient and family centred care. Applicants are required to have a demonstrated understanding and commitment to this care philosophy. This position understands the importance of quality and safety and requires a high degree of attention to detail and excellent time management skills. Proficiency in both official languages is required.

ESC 023/22 Part-Time B Care Coordinator (Multiple Opportunities)

STARTING DATE: We are regularly recruiting for this role

POSITION STATUS: Part-time B

HOURS OF WORK: Applicants must be available for a minimum of five (5) shifts in a two-week period (up to37.5 hours per week) [Shifts (tours) will be scheduled between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 8:00 p.m.]

SALARY RANGE: In accordance with the Collective Agreement

NATURE OF THE POSITION

The Home and Community Care Support Services Erie St. Clair assists individuals in accessing community health care services and information. The Home and Community Care Support Services Erie St. Clair works with eligible patient’s and arranges for professional services, with Contracted Service Providers, such as nursing, physiotherapy, occupational therapy, speech and language services, social work, nutritional counseling, personal support, and medical supplies, to help patients reach the best possible level of health and independence while remaining in their home.

The Home and Community Care Support Services Erie St. Clair Care Coordinator is a health care professional who works with patients and their families and/or caregivers to help develop a plan of care that helps patients meet their healthcare needs and goals for independence. The Care Coordinator determines patient eligibility for services and assesses their needs. The Care Coordinator:

· Completes an assessment

· Develops health goals with the patient and their caregiver

· Assists individuals to access resources through community support agencies

· Provides support for eligible individuals through contracted service provider agencies

· Monitors and reassesses patient needs to ensure that their plan of care remains up-to-date and revises the plan as needed

· Helps the patient apply for Adult Day Programs and for residency in Long-Term Care Homes

We are currently seeking Part-time B Care Coordinators to work in a variety of settings (hospital, office, community) to join our team and provide an effective, seamless delivery of health care services to our community.

Using your proficiency in computer skills, you will perform face-to-face assessments by documenting information on a laptop computer while visiting with patients in their homes or the hospital. You will also provide information and referral services to non-eligible patients to help them navigate through the complexities of the health care environment.

QUALIFICATIONS:

· A University Degree from a recognized university in a health-related field; an equivalent of education and experience may be considered.

· A practitioner in one of the following health disciplines: Nursing (RN), Physiotherapy, Occupational Therapy, Social Work, Dietetics, or Speech-Language Pathology

· Current registration in good standing in the relevant Regulated Health Professional College in Ontario

· At least two years of relevant work experience an asset

· Excellent interpersonal communication skills

· An oral/written proficiency with Canada’s two official languages will be looked upon favourably.

· Must possess a valid driver’s license and have access to a vehicle

· Must be able to operate a computer

Hours of work: 7.5-hour shift (tour) between the hours of 8:00 and 20:00. Home and Community Care Support Services Erie St. Clair is accessible seven days per week, including weekends, and statutory holidays.

Availability Requirements:

All new Part-time B hires are required to be available for 6 week’s full-time (37.5 hours per week) orientation (fully paid)

In order to maintain your employment status as a Part-Time B Care Coordinator, you must provide the following availability:

Part-time B (PT B) is an employee who does not have any guaranteed hours of work but is one who is available:

i) Minimum five (5) shifts in a two week period, with availability on those days from 0800-2000 hours, not to exceed thirty-seven and one-half (37.5) hours per week. At least one day of availability per week must be a Monday or a Friday

ii) One (1) weekend out of three (3)

iii) Available for five (5) paid holidays in each fiscal year including one of Christmas and New Year’s day. Christmas and New Year’s Day availability will be rotated on a yearly basis and applicable to operational hours.

iv) Available forty-four (44) calendar weeks per year

v) No more than 3 weeks’ off during summer period (July and August)

vi) No more than fifty percent (50%) of PT B employees in any site may make themselves unavailable in any one month. If there is a conflict in the non-availability indicated by employees, the conflict will be resolved on the basis of seniority

Availability for Part Time B must be submitted in writing as per the process established by the parties, by the due dates on the following table:

Availability Submitted by:

Scheduling Month:

Availability Submitted by: Scheduling Month:
December 1st - January
January 1st - February & March
March 1st - April
April 1st - May
May 1st - June, July & August
August 1st - September
October 1st - November & December

After the schedule has been posted, the PTB employee will have no obligations to availability except as scheduled.

Please submit your cover letter and resume no later than 4:30PM, June 30, 2022

Please include the reference “ESC 023/22 Part-Time B Care Coordinator” and your preferred site in your e-mail subject line.

By submitting an application, applicants are consenting to the sharing of their personal information with individuals from Home and Community Care Support Services Erie St. Clair who are participating in the selection process.

Home and Community Care Support Services Erie St. Clair is an equal opportunity employer. Individuals with a disability requiring accommodation during the application and/or the interview process should advise the recruitment contact so arrangements can be made.

As a condition of employment and in compliance with the Home and Community Care Support Services mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, all employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. All staff are required to provide proof of vaccination with the following exceptions, in which case there would be a requirement to undergo regular COVID-19 rapid antigen screening tests:

· If there is a valid medical reason for not being fully vaccinated against COVID-19, documentation must be provided by a Medical Doctor or Nurse Practitioner and include the effective time-period for the medical reason

· If there is valid human rights grounds (e.g. religious beliefs), evidence must be provided in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and deemed satisfactory to Home and Community Care Support Services

At the time of submission of the signed offer letter, new hire staff must provide proof of vaccination in the form of a copy of their vaccination receipts (with the watermark) from the Ontario COVID-19 Vaccination site at https://covid19.ontariohealth.ca. Upon request, we will provide you with the medical and human rights exemption forms. Your start date may be delayed if the required documentation is not received prior to the date you are to commence employment.

We thank all applicants for their interest, but advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Application question(s):

  • A practitioner in one of the following health disciplines: Nursing (RN), Physiotherapy, Occupational Therapy, Social Work, Dietetics, or Speech-Language Pathology

Experience:

  • relevant work: 2 years (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • registration in relevant RHP College in Ontario (required)

Application deadline: 2022-06-30

title: Market Research & Insights Manager
description:
Site Name: Canada - Ontario - Mississauga
Posted Date: Mar 24 2022


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Demonstration of an agile mindset, fearless collaboration and an appetite for ongoing learning
  • Responsible for oversight/consultation on all market research studies
  • Responsible to develop and nurture positive relationships with colleagues from diverse backgrounds on a global scale, and to ensure inclusion in global market research and trackers as appropriate
  • Responsible for maintaining the market research preferred supplier list, preferred supplier list tracker, and SCC list requirements.
  • Responsible for archiving all required market research project documents to WISE, and for maintaining the Market Research Project Tracker.
  • Undertake market research projects as defined jointly by marketing and BI (e.g. Patient journey, landscaping, customer values, quantitative)
  • Share new and innovative methodologies to uncover key insights to drive strategy and win in competitive markets
  • Use research to present a full situational analysis by brand, to kick start all brand planning cycles and POA discussions
  • Provide strategic recommendations for cross functional team based on gleaned insights from research
  • Responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with third party suppliers to remain abreast of cutting edge/proprietary analyses, and to ensure appropriate service during the course of study execution
  • Develop and nurture relationships with cross functional partners to ensure that market research is conducted in a manner that supports business needs while remaining compliant to all processes, removing barriers, and effectively managing resources
  • Develop, maintain and deliver training for reviewers of market research materials
  • Proactively engage marketers to ensure that they effectively undertake market research studies throughout the year, and particularity for strategic planning, that support strategies and tactics, elucidate opportunities and barriers, and provide measurement for business reviews
  • Deliver capability and understanding across the organization for market research and share knowledge and best practices across enterprise
  • Understand how to recommend and incorporate novel market research approaches and insights into all facets of business (marketing and sales strategy, forecasting, performance tracking, etc)

Other activities include but are not limited to:-

  • Governance Monitoring
  • Documentation control

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor degree
  • Minimum 2 years of recent market research experience in specialty care field
  • Demonstrated experience and performance in a comparable role with exposure to pharmaceutical commercial and market research regulations
  • Solid understanding of good governance and risk management essential, with a keen eye for detail including third party vendor oversight and budget management
  • Experience in multi tasking, prioritizing, managing a breadth and volume of activities on a day to day basis to satisfactory conclusion and delivering to the required timelines
  • Experience in working across boundaries with diverse internal & external cross functional stakeholders, spanning varied levels of hierarchy
  • Experience in all areas of market research including developing comprehensive market research plans connected to brand strategy and advanced analytic interpretation techniques (multivariate analysis, key driver, discrete choice, conjoint, etc)
  • Experience in presenting to large groups and successfully influencing without authority
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • 2+ years of market research experience
  • Experience with demonstrated knowledge and understanding within the following areas: Brand Strategy, New Product Introduction/launch, Marketing Communication, Promotions, Media Planning, and Contracting
  • An understanding of the various laws, codes of conduct and ethical market research practices (i.e. MRIA, PIPEDA, IMC, etc.)

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Lead - Vaccines Access Strategy
description:
Site Name: Canada - Ontario - Mississauga
Posted Date: Apr 26 2022


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • A key NEW role in the Government Affairs and Market Access Division, reporting to the Director, Federal Affairs, Public Health and Public Policy, the Lead – Vaccines Access Strategy is responsible for developing and overseeing the execution and implementation of Plans/Tactics aligned to our Strategy for Sustained Adult Vaccines Performance.


Specifically, the incumbent will:

  • Lead market access planning for key existing brands in the adult vaccination space (e.g. SHINGRIX) based on all indications; as well as key pipeline assets, including GSK’s candidate RSV vaccine for older adults. (Note: SHINGRIX is well-positioned to deliver value to patients and the health system, being the first vaccine targeted towards both immunocompetent and immunocompromised populations, delivering unprecedented efficacy (>90%) in adults.)
  • Work in collaboration with GSK’s Private Payer Manager, as well as GSK’s regionally-embedded Public Health Managers, to lead and oversee synergistic planning and tactical execution in the private and public markets (including stakeholder mapping, value narrarive, awareness planning and stakeholder engagement planning.)
  • Building on access successes in Ontario, PEI and the Yukon, this role will drive national efforts on continued adoption and rollout of shingles Universal Mass Vaccination (UMV) programs from coast-to-coast-to-coast.
  • Working in partnership with GSK Public Health Managers, Commercial Team, Pharmacy Team, and Communications, develop and oversee the implementation of innovative pull-through strategies in partnership with payers to optimize patient access to existing UMV programs and close gaps in shingles prevention for seniors and at-risk adults.
  • Working cross-functionally with GSK’s Medical Affairs Team, the Lead – Vaccines Strategy will also shape and execute strategic policy change /modernization initiatives aimed at NACI/PHAC/CIQ.
  • Commit to execution excellence to increase probability of success and continued value delivery to patients and society (i.e. set clear KPIs to measure vaccine access implementation success and conduct regular horizon scans).
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable legislation and codes of conduct, and GSK Values.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Candidates should have graduate-level education in the field of business, public health or health policy.
  • 7-10 years of market access experience relevant to vaccines.
  • Outstanding interpersonal, communication, negotiation and influencing skills
  • Must understand the influence of stakeholders and political decision makers in acceleration of UMVs (e.g. knowledge of best-practice examples build a broad support network locally, turn stakeholders into active advocates and maintain continuous proximity to key decision-makers. Understand also the role of media in influencing such decisions.)
  • Exceptional project management and leadership skills in a cross-functional matrix team environment
  • Successful candidate must have the ability and aptitude to thrive in an ambiguous environment. They will be self-starting, and have a demonstrable passion for public /seniors health, and life sceinces research and development.
  • Outstanding technical written and verbal communication skills, as well as presentation skills
  • Broad knowledge of healthcare issues and the pharmaceutical / life science industry is an asset.
  • Knowledge of the role and function of NACI and CIQ.
  • Demonstration of strategic agility and commercial experience beyond market access is also an asset.
  • Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset;

  • This position is open to applicants legally authorized to work in Canada

  • LI-GSK

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: newPharmacist
description:
Company description:

Medicine Shoppe #320 is an independently-owned pharmacy located in the Glenwood Medical Building. We are a closely-knit team emphasizing personalized care for our patients and collaboration with other healthcare professionals in our building. We are looking for a knowledgeable and friendly individual to join our team as staff pharmacist. We offer competitive wages and a clinical services bonus incentive.

Job description:

Day-to-day, the staff pharmacist is responsible for leading the pharmacy team to fulfill pharmacy operation duties, including but not limited to:

- Prescription and data entry;

- Accurate and timely preparation of prescriptions, both in vials and in compliance packaging;

- Providing clinical services, including injections, patient assessments, medication reconciliations, care plans, and any other activity defined within the scope of practice of pharmacists in Alberta;

- Providing counseling on both prescription and over-the-counter medications;

- Collaborating with other healthcare professionals, such as patients' primary doctors, nurses, care homes, etc. to optimize patient care;

- Upholding federal and provincial legislations, standards of practice, and codes of ethics in accordance with pharmacy practice in Canada;

- Managing inventory to ensure appropriate levels of stock are maintained; and

- Answering and resolving patient questions and concerns.

Qualifications:

- Bachelor of Science in Pharmacy from a recognized institution.

- Current registration with the Alberta College of Pharmacy.

- Certified to administer drugs by injection.

- Additional Prescribing Authority; or, the successful candidate must obtain APA within 1 year of hiring.

- Full vaccination status against COVID-19; or, valid medical exemption for COVID-19 vaccination.

Preferred qualifications:

- Previous experience of at least 1 year in clinical pharmacy (PCN, community clinic, hospital, etc.) is preferred.

- Previous experience as a pharmacy manager, licensee, or other leader in pharmacy practice is preferred. Previous experience overseeing pharmacy operations, managing operational changes, or planning and executing pharmacy-related projects is an asset.

- Previous experience with Nexxsys is an asset.

Job details:

Benefits: extended health care, dental care, clinical services bonus

Schedule: Tue-Fri, 8 hours; Sat, 5 hours

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $45.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • pharmacist: 1 year (preferred)

title: Veterinary Receptionist
description:
Job description

Come and join our talented and hardworking team in beautiful Bracebridge, Muskoka! The centre of all the lakes, hiking trails and outdoor activities.
Bracebridge Animal Hospital is looking for a passionate, self-motivated, hard working and reliable Client Services Representative – Reception, in a full-time position. We are a 2 doctor, AAHA accredited, companion animal hospital that focuses on dogs, cats, pocket pets and some exotics.
Our priority is providing patients and clients with exceptional, quality service; using only the highest caliber of medication and technology. Our clinic has strict COVID protocols in place for the health & safety of our team and clients.

We pride ourselves on being a team with a positive attitude that works cohesively together. We lead each other to greatness to achieve goals and execute outstanding patient and client services.

Job Responsibilities Include:

  • Provide exceptional and expeditious client experience
  • Greet clients curbside and incoming calls
  • Process incoming and outgoing pets – invoicing and prescriptions
  • Answer phone calls, which may involve answering medical questions, screening for service needs and scheduling appointments.
  • Attend to incoming and outgoing mail and e-mail
  • Document and maintain client information, service data and other pertinent information with business operations software
  • Facilitating medical prescriptions
  • Assist doctors, technicians and other personnel with the administration of medications and restraining pets for procedures and treatments, and assisting with curbside services
  • Ensure all supplies are stocked in pharmacy, treatment and surgery areas
  • General cleaning and maintenance duties throughout the clinic (examination rooms/treatment areas/reception/utility areas). Including daily laundry
  • Limited reception duties as needed

Experience and skills:

  • Must be a self-starter, able to multitask and a team player.
  • Genuinely enjoys working with people and animals and is able to deal with them even when they are stressed (ill or in pain – animals).
  • Prefer 1+ years of experience in Veterinary clinic, but not required.
  • Comfortable with dealing with stressful situations and handling in a professional manner
  • Ability to comfortably use POS software systems, Microsoft Word and Excel
  • Ability to meet the physical demands of the job. Work requires lifting, carrying and restraining boxes/animals (will be assisted by other staff members in lifting animals over 30 lbs.). Should be able to lift 30lbs on own.
  • Walks or stands for extended periods or time
  • Is experienced in the teamwork approach and works well with all levels of hospital team members.
Employment Incentives:
  • Offering competitive industry wages, health benefits, RRSP matching
  • Yearly clothing and Continuing Education allowance
  • Discounts in hospital on products & treatments, and professional services and complimentary IDEXX services for your pet(s)
  • No weekend or late evening shifts

If you are passionate about animals and are interested in joining a team of highly devoted animal advocates, our hospital may be the right fit for you.
Those interested and qualified applicants can submit a Cover Letter and Resume to holly.marko@nva.com Only those candidates invited for an interview will be contacted.

title: Veterinary Assistant
description:
Plessis Veterinary Hospital is a full service companion animal hospital located in Transcona. We are currently seeking an Veterinary Assistant to add to our growing veterinary team.

The position offers full-time hours varying between mornings, evenings and weekends. The ideal candidate is motivated, personable and punctual, organized, has strong communication skills and works well in a team environment. The Veterinary Assistant will be responsible for maintaining a clean work environment while ensuring the patients receive the highest standard of care. You must be comfortable handling dogs and cats that very in size and temperament. Experience in a veterinary setting is preferred, however we are willing to train the right person.

Veterinary Assistants are expected to perform the following daily duties to the standards of the hospital:

Ø Being available to assist the doctors, RVTs, fellow assistants and receptionist in varying tasks

Ø To perform and complete any task delegated by the doctors and fellow staff members

Ø Preparing any supplies and equipment needed for a procedure and cleaning up after it is completed

Ø Ensuring the patients in our care are being monitored, fed, and walked. This includes:

o That medications and procedures given at the proper time

o The patient is in a clean environment (i.e., kennel/run, bedding, etc.)

o Proper care notes are being put on the patient’s file

Ø Disinfecting and cleaning the following between every patient:

o All runs and kennels

o Equipment

o Food/water bowls

o Countertops/Procedure tables

o X-ray machine

o Dental tables

Ø Completing all care calls that are categorized as Non-critical

Ø Answering any questions or concerns that the client may have

Ø Keeping up to date on all food and OTC information

The following are to be performed by all staff members:

Ø All staff members, regardless of their position, are to perform their duties properly and professional

Ø If you do not know the answer to a question or do not know how to perform/prepare for a task or procedure, please do not guess or assume. Ask a doctor, RVT, or fellow staff member to help you

Ø Remember that as a hospital we deal with sensitive information (i.e., client and patient information) Privacy is to be held, kept, and respected at all times.

The clinic provides a positive work environment this is highly inclusive. We offer full health and benefits packages to full time employees, competitive pay that will be discussed with the right canidate and paid uniforms.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: From $1.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Winnipeg, MB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Veterinary Assistant: 1 year (preferred)
  • Customer service: 1 year (preferred)

title: Sr. Associate, Regulatory Operations
description:
Site Name: Mississauga Standish Court
Posted Date: Apr 1 2022


Job Purpose :

To support local regulatory operations and compliance activities for Canada.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Information management: Responsible for maintaining local compliance and accuracy of regulatory documentation systems (e.g. VEEVA). Resolve conflicts, ensure data integrity. Responsible for updates to other relevant global, regional and local databases to ensure compliance of product information. Prepare and maintain documentation for local listing of products (e.g. provincial schedule, formulary schedule)
  • Operations support: Responsible for the preparation and assigning of product attributes of electronic documents for publishing to support regulatory submissions along with other required tasks. With oversight, prepares and complies regulatory submissions, responses to regulatory agency questions and other correspondence. Obtains copyright clearance.
  • Manages local SOP and training programs. Supports compliance activities such as L1 monitoring.
  • Assist with research or other assignments to support submission, operation or compliance activities in Canada.
  • Liase with QA, manufacturing sites and global CMC to obtain technical information to create change events in VEEVA..
  • Develops and inputs into related processes to increase efficiencies for wider department.
  • Performs related duties as assigned.

Preferred Level of Education :

BA or BSc or Science/Laboratory College Diploma or relevant experience

Job-Related Experience:


  • 4-6 years pharmaceutical industry experience preferred (RA, QA, Compliance). Familiarity with change control and regulatory publishing would be an asset. Other relevant industry experience with database maintenance and compliance activities would be considered.

  • Compliance to regulatory requirements is essential to Corporate compliance and product portfolio/sales maintenance. Familiarity with the industry is preferred.

  • LI-GSK

title: newVeterinary Business Manager - Veterinary Teaching Hospital -...
description:
The Veterinary Teaching Hospital (VTH) at the Atlantic Veterinary College (AVC), University of Prince Edward Island (UPEI) invites applications for a full-time Veterinary Business Manager position.

This term position May 2022 to April 30, 2023, would work with a team of three other members of the VTH management team, and under the direction of the Assistant Dean of Clinical & Professional Programming, serving as the Emergency Services and Evening Manager of the VTH. The VTH management team work together to supervise the administrative and technical support staff within the hospital; support the supervision of the emergency service; ensure smooth day to day operations; foster an environment that optimizes the client experience, patient care, and student learning; and create and follow policy that leads to long-term, sustainable vision planning for the VTH. Specifically, the Emergency Services and Evening Manager will focus on:

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • The supervisory duties of this position will focus on the emergency services team (Direct supervision of 12 people)
  • Provide support and back-up to the Operations Manager and Client Liaison Manager with respect to staffing, vacancy management, leave management, etc. when they are away from the hospital
  • Maintain compliance with University policies/procedures and the collective agreement as they directly relate to accurate management of HR, including following through with disciplinary procedures
  • Monitor and assist in the efficient operations and management of the financial resources of the VTH including budget management
  • Prepare financial statements and reports, including the preparation of quarterly and annual business reports, advisory council reports, accreditation reports, etc.
  • Monitor and forecast VTH revenue and expenditures
  • Assist in the development of the new primary emergency clinic
  • Provide reports and analytics on the revenue, expenditures, and projections associated with the emergency clinic to help in the assessment of its long term sustainability
  • Work with Client Liaison Manager in maintaining a communications strategy and referral relationships
  • Work with Operations Manager on facility and operational needs
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Doctor of Veterinary Medicine with business/management experience -or- minimum 4-year business degree with veterinary clinical experience -or- the equivalent combination of education and relevant experience (RVTs would be considered)
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in veterinary medicine
  • Preference given to an individual with experience in veterinary practice management
  • Preference given to an individual with experience in managing people
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to effectively manage multiple priorities
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Detailed knowledge of and experience in working with computerized accounting systems and/or electronic medical records systems, spreadsheets and database software
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills – verbal and written
  • Additional skills training in communications, marketing, or business administration an asset
Additional information may be found in the attached Job Description.

title: Casual Medical Lab Assistant
description:
The Laboratory Assistant provides support to the Medical Laboratory Technologists by carrying out central accessioning, pre analytical, and post analytical functions. Duties will include: - Checking and entering all request forms and entering information for specimens received from specimen receiving, doctors offices, nursing homes, etc., as well as information for specimens collected in hospital by nursing until electronic ordering is implemented;- receiving and registering specimens and making sure all specimens are adequately identified;- generating bar code labels, sorting laboratory specimens and delivering sorted and labeled specimens to appropriate divisions in timely manner;- sorting and delivering printed laboratory reports within laboratory office and to appropriate mail slots in hospital doctors lounge;- greeting patients, ensuring accuracy of patients identification;- obtaining blood and other specimens from patients, including adults and children;- providing support to laboratory technologists with pre-analytical and post-analytical processing, including centrifugation and aliquoting specimens, preparing and staining slides, incubation of cultures, entering patient data, filing, etc;- cleaning and maintaining equipment and processing areas, as well as maintaining supply inventories;- answering telephone inquiries, photocopying and faxing reports as required;- other duties as required.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications: - Must have successfully completed a laboratory assistant training program from a recognized educational institution or have successfully completed a Bachelor of Science degree majoring in chemistry, biology, microbiology or other related science and in house training in an accredited health care institution.- Must be registered with the CSMLS as a certified laboratory assistant.- Must have knowledge of medical terminology.- Must have keyboarding experience.- Must have phlebotomy training or experience.- Must have technical experience in a medical laboratory or other related health field.- Must have a good previous work and attendance record.- Additional relevant education and experience will be considered an asset.Please note: Casual employment lists are used to meet staffing needs arising from vacation, sick, and other short-term leaves and will be dependent on the needs of the employer. Please ensure your application clearly demonstrates how you meet the noted qualifications, as applicants will be screened based on the information provided. Applications will be kept on file for one year. We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: newPractice Manager
description:
At Annex Animal Hospital we believe it is a privilege to be allowed to care for your pets. It is important to have an understanding of the level of care provided for your pets in the clinic and behind the scenes. Our standard of care for our patients encompasses safety, comfort, and compassion while practicing progressive, high-quality medicine with the assistance of modern medical equipment and diagnostic testing. Our veterinary care team has been carefully selected for their level of knowledge, experience, and proven ability to provide compassionate care. We employ Licensed Doctors of Veterinary Medicine, Registered Veterinary Technicians, skilled Veterinary Assistants & excellent Customer Care Representatives. Since 1978 we have filled our teams with passionate individuals who enjoy what they do and we are committed to excellence in customer service and patient care.

The clinic is well designed in order to facilitate good workflow, and we have space to grow. Annex Animal Hospital currently has three full time DVMs, and are equipped with well rounded support staff and a great management team to support our staff.

ABOUT THE ROLE

The successful candidate will oversee the smooth and efficient operations of the hospital and ensure an awesome client experience while maintaining a great team morale. The Practice Manager must have business and human resources acumen and be able to effectively manage and support their people, drive revenue growth, and execute on expense control.

Our clients have high expectations and the manager must embody above and beyond client service, empathetic communication and they must continue to set and uphold the standard for the team. The successful candidate will spend a portion of time allocated to administrative duties and team leadership, the remaining time working alongside a team.

Some responsibilities include:

  • Oversee smooth and efficient operations of the clinics
  • Recruit train and motivate staff
  • Handle human resource issues when they arise and escalate to the Operations Director when needed
  • Work with the Operations Director to create and execute the vision for the clinics
  • Help grow the clinics in both revenue and new clientele
  • Create action plans for the clinic and staff to maximize success
  • Prepare regular reports on a weekly basis

AS OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE YOU WILL HAVE:

  • An abiding love of animals and a deep understanding of the human/animal bond
  • Previous experience as a manager, preferably in the veterinary, retail, or healthcare industry is an asset
  • Experience with shifts, and drafting/managing schedules
  • Good management and leadership skills with the ability to set priorities, delegate, motivate and develop the hospital and team to become top performers in the community
  • You must be a client service professional, who puts the client first at all times and an experienced people manager, who has hired, trained and held people accountable for their performance
  • Developed emotional intelligence to be able to contain emotional situations around the clinic
  • Solid communication skills, both when dealing with clients and interpersonal relationships
  • Collaboration skills demonstrating a strong desire to build rapport and solid relationships with team members, clients and the community
  • Financial skills to understand the needs of the business and the importance of growing revenues and controlling expenses
  • Passion for what you do every day! Enthusiasm, energy and a positive attitude are a must

The Practice managers are the gatekeepers of the clinic and they will be fully supported by the Operations Director, with access to different resources, including continuous training and development to support and ensure their success in managing the clinic.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $52,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Employee assistance program
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: Contract Assessment and Outreach Worker
description:
The Neighbourhood Group (TNG) is a multi-service agency that includes Central Neighbourhood House, Neighbourhood Link Support Services and St. Stephen’s Community House

POSITION TITLE: Contract Assessment and Outreach Worker

DEPARTMENT: Independent Living

STATUS: Contract Full-Time, CUPE7797

# HRS / WEEK: 35

CONTRACT DATES: ASAP to June 30, 2022, or the return of the incumbent, whichever comes earlier

REPORT TO: Senior Manager, Community Support

HOURLY RATE: $27.48

POSTING DATE: March 28, 2022

GENERAL DESCRIPTION: Conduct client assessments in a consistent, timely, responsive manner, including an overview of programs and services. Receive and respond to requests for service by providing internal and external referrals. Provide outreach to the community and liaise with other agencies and networks, in order to promote the aims, programs and services of The Neighbourhood Group. This position reports to Senior Manager, Community Support and is part of CUPE LOCAL 7797.

MAJOR DUTIES:

· Contact clients as necessary and on a priority basis to schedule assessments and reassessments using the interRAI Community Health Assessment (CHA) tool.

· Assess the home environment of clients, provide crisis intervention and notify community workers, medical, public health, or social workers of deteriorating conditions as deemed appropriate.

· Provide input to the development and/or revision of clients’ care plans.

· With clients’ consent, advocate on their behalf with hospitals, doctors, social service and government agencies, clients' families, and community groups. Provide assistance where possible in negotiating with landlords, social service and government agencies. Advise clients of their rights and obligations, and network with agencies to ensure the quality and timeliness of social services.

· Review all new client intakes/reassessments with the Senior Manager on a regular basis.

· Discuss client information with assigned community worker to ensure a smooth transition to agency services.

· Provide internal and external referrals to meet client needs and follow up where appropriate.

· Collect, enter and maintain accurate records of contacts, consent forms, client status, client files, and any other relevant documentation in the database.

· Transportation scheduling as required and be available for emergencies in the Agency office.

· Drive and or escort clients to and from appointments as required.

REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS:

· A Social Worker or Social Service Worker diploma from an O.C.S.W./S.S.W. recognized institution.

· Three or more years of professional experience providing care and assessments to seniors.

· Knowledge of the intraRAI CHA tool preferred.

· Knowledge of the policies and objectives of the agency, and of the social, legal, and health care services available to seniors in the community.

· The ability to assess clients' situations accurately and to recognize deteriorating social and/or health conditions.

· The ability to work with minimal supervision, and manage time effectively.

· The ability to advocate for clients and to organize and coordinate a wide variety of services to assist clients.

· The ability to speak in public and to perform community outreach.

· The ability to assess clients situation and act on any crisis situation/report to the Senior Manager.

· Familiarity with keeping information in a database manager. Knowledge of the CIMS database would be an asset.

· Attend weekly, biweekly, monthly meetings with Primary Community Care Response Teams (PCCRT’s) to review clients care plans, as required.

· A valid Ontario Driver’s License is preferred.

TNG is committed to reflecting the communities we serve and to nurturing a respectful and inclusive work environment for all. We encourage qualified applicants of all ages, races, colours, ethnic origins, religions, abilities, gender identities, gender expression and sexual orientations to apply. Candidates invited for an interview are encouraged to inform Human Resources in confidence of their accommodation requirement.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $27.48 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Do you have a Social Worker or Social Service Worker diploma from an O.C.S.W./S.S.W. recognized institution?

Experience:

  • providing care and assessments to seniors: 3 years (required)

title: Registered Nurses, Full Time, & Part-Time
description:
Imagine a supportive employer, a career that allows you to follow your passion and the endless learning opportunities you will receive. To do what you're good at and be a part of something extraordinary.

At West Haldimand General, you can experience all of that and more. We are currently looking for Registered Nurses, like you, to join our Inpatient team and gain valuable health care experience for your future.

Our Inpatient Unit, has 23 beds and provides care for adult medical/surgical patients. Patients with a wide variety of clinical conditions are treated, including those who are recovering from surgeries, those hospitalized for acute conditions, and others who may be in the final stages of a progressive and chronic disease.

WHGH’s Medical team includes Nurses, Family Physicians, Pharmacists, Dietitian, Physiotherapists, Physiotherapy Assistants, Ward Clerks, and Volunteers.

As an added incentive, the Government of Canada also has a student loan forgiveness program for nurses working in rural hospitals like ours. You can apply for up to $20,000 in Canada Student Loan forgiveness over a maximum of five years ($4,000 per year). You can find more information about the Government of Canada's incentive program here: https://www.canada.ca/.../assistance/doctors-nurses.html

WHGH is just a short 30 minute drive away from Simcoe, Brantford and Hamilton. Come join our friendly and experienced team today!

POSITION REQUIREMENTS

1. Current Certification of Competence with the College of Nurses of Ontario as a Registered Nurse.

2. Current B.C.L.S. (Basic Cardiac Life Support)

3. Current A.C.L.S. (Advance Cardiac Life Support) or willing to obtain

4. Current knowledge and recent experience in an I.C.U./C.C.U. is an asset. We welcome new nursing graduates and can assist you to learn nursing skills.

5. Demonstrated ability to interact with patients, families and other members of the health care team in an effective, professional, safe, positive caring manner.

6. Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.

7. Effective communicator with strong, interpersonal skills and problem solving.

8. Demonstrated leadership and organizational skills.

9. Safety (patient, worker & workplace) is a WHGH Corporate Priority. The successful applicant will demonstrate good stewardship in the identification, reporting and mitigation of unsafe acts or conditions

10. For current employees: past performance and attendance will be considered as part of the selection process.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $34.24-$49.02 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Registered Nurse (RN) License (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-02

title: newSuperviseur de production – Inspection visuelle
description:
Site Name: Canada - Quebec - Quebec
Posted Date: May 2 2022


** Seuls les candidats vivant actuellement au Canada, avec le droit légal de travailler ici, seront considérés. **

**Only candidates currently living in Canada, with the legal right to work here, will be considered.**

Objectifs du poste :

  • Assurer le leadership de son secteur de production en gérant la sécurité, la qualité et l'amélioration continue.

  • Superviser le travail des chefs d’équipes, des préposés techniques ou tout autre employé externe dans son secteur.

  • S'assurer que tous les équipements, les améliorations continues, la révision des dossiers et des déviations sont livrées en respectant la qualité et les échéanciers.

  • Maintenir les systèmes de production efficaces. Conduire l'amélioration continue et la gestion de la performance.

  • Responsable de la gestion et du développement de son personnel.

Job Objectives:

  • Ensure the leadership of its production sector by managing safety, quality and continuous improvement.

  • Supervise the work of team leaders, technical attendants or any other external employee in your sector.

  • Ensure that all equipment, continuous improvements, revision of files and deviations are delivered respecting quality and deadlines.

  • Maintain efficient production systems.

  • Drive continuous improvement and performance management. R

  • Responsible for the management and development of your staff.

-

Connaissances spécialisées :

Exigences :

  • Universitaire ou collégial (chimie, microbiologie ou autre domaine connexe)

  • 2 années d'expérience dans la gestion du personnel

  • 2 à 3 années d'expérience en pharmaceutiques, alimentaire ou industrie hautement règlementée.

Basic Qualifications:

  • University or college (chemistry, microbiology or other related field)

  • 2 years of experience in personnel management

  • 2 to 3 years of experience in pharmaceutical, food or highly regulated industry.

-

Autres compétences ou acquis liés au poste :

  • Excellentes compétences organisationnelles et multitâches

  • Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et orale

  • Solides aptitudes à résoudre des problèmes

  • Capacité de collaborer et de construire des relations

  • Utilisation d'un bon jugement pour prendre des décisions

  • Connaissance des procédés de production et des équipements

  • Expérience dans l'application des systèmes d’amélioration continue

  • Connaissance des politiques réglementaires de GSK pour l’environnement, la santé, la sécurité et la qualité sont considérées comme un atout

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Excellent organizational and multitasking skills

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills

  • Strong problem solving skills Ability to collaborate and build relationships

  • Using good judgment to make decisions

  • Knowledge of production processes and equipment

  • Experience in the application of continuous improvement systems

  • Knowledge of GSK regulatory policies for environment, health, safety and quality is considered an asset

-

Principales responsabilités :


SANTÉ ET SÉCURITÉ

  • Respecter et faire respecter les procédures de santé, sécurité et environnement

  • Veiller au respect des obligations règlementaires en matière de santé, sécurité et environnement

  • Participer aux analyses de risques de son secteur

  • Respecter et faire respecter les règles de sécurité, notamment le port des équipements de protection individuelle

  • Veiller à la sécurité en déclarant les situations à risques, et en arrêtant toute situation dangereuse dont il dont il est témoin ou qui lui est escaladé

  • Identifier les facteurs d’amélioration

QUALITÉ

  • Diriger une équipe de personnel opérationnel pour produire le vaccin en conformité avec toutes les exigences réglementaires

  • Connaître, faire appliquer et appliquer de façon rigoureuse les procédures en lien avec son secteur

  • S’assurer de la mise à jour des procédures du secteur

  • S’assurer de l’identification de la documentation, de l’escalation adéquate des problèmes qualité en lien avec son secteur

  • Participer et apporter du support lors des investigations en cas de déviations et de CAPA

  • Participer aux audits et aux inspections en lien avec son secteur

AUTRES

  • Assurer une gestion appropriée des ressources pour la mise en œuvre du plan de production, en veillant à ce que le personnel ait les moyens, la capacité, la responsabilité et l'engagement nécessaires pour réussir le plan établit

  • Amener les employés à devenir responsables de la réalisation des objectifs sectoriels

  • Optimiser les processus de gestion et de planification qui consistent à suivre, enregistrer et approuver les vacances, le rendement, l'absentéisme et les heures supplémentaires

  • Travailler avec la planification pour équilibrer le plan de production et les ressources tout en assurant une collaboration avec toutes les fonctions afin de s'assurer que le processus de production et la livraison du plan de production est une priorité. Escalade les problèmes selon les besoins

  • Être disponible pour le coaching quotidien des employés en utilisant la gestion de proximité pour éviter les écarts et pour promouvoir le développement des compétences en cours

  • Prioriser sa charge de travail et celle de son équipe en fonction des priorités du site et des départements support

  • Mobiliser et développer ses employés pour les orienter vers la performance

  • Implémenter et maintenir les principes d’améliorations continues

  • Fournir un support technique, développer et maintenir les indicateurs clés pour gérer la performance et les analyses de tendance

  • Analyser les opérations et orchestrer les activités pour assurer l’optimisation de l’utilisation des ressources disponibles

  • Anticiper les défis et identifier les opportunités à escalader

  • Contribuer à la réalisation des stratégies de l’entreprise en supportant les opérations lors des inspections régulatrices et les inspections internes

  • Travailler près de opérations, de l’assurance qualité et des autres départements support pour stratégiquement identifier et résoudre les problèmes existants

  • Assurer l’alignement avec les partenaires et travailler en étroite collaboration avec les autres Unités opérationnelles

  • LI-GSK

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.', 'Maintain efficient production systems.', 'Excellent written and oral communication skills', 'Experience in the application of continuous improvement systems', 'Strong problem solving skills Ability to collaborate and build relationships', 'Supervise the work of team leaders, technical attendants or any other external employee in your sector.', '2 years of experience in personnel management', 'Excellent organizational and multitasking skills', 'University or college (chemistry, microbiology or other related field)', '2 to 3 years of experience in pharmaceutical, food or highly regulated industry.', 'Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies', 'Drive continuous improvement and performance management. title: newClerk, Rehabilitation Services
description:
Why Fraser Health?:
Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.
Effective October 26, 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.
Bring your positive energy and your outstanding organizational and people skills to the challenging and rewarding role of Relief Part Time Clerk to our Rehabilitation Services Department at Queen's Park Care Centre in New Westminster, BC. Develop new skills working with experienced professionals and share our dedication to provide quality service to our clients.
Detailed Overview:
The Clerk, Rehabilitation Services schedules and books patient appointments and registers and admits patients for rehabilitation within the program. Performs a variety of related clerical duties such as typing materials, preparing invoices for patients, performing reception duties, setting up and maintaining files, timekeeping, and maintaining office supplies and records.
Responsibilities:
  • Schedules and books patient appointments by receiving appointment requests, making follow up appointments, assigning and adjusting dates and times in accordance with established guidelines, maintaining patient wait list, contacting doctor's offices, patient or unit to confirm patient appointment and directing patients to the appropriate area.
  • Registers and admits new patients for rehabilitation within the program by obtaining and entering patient information, contacting referral agencies such as doctors and health care facilities to verify patient information, and completing admission and other required forms.
  • Sets up and maintains filing systems for various department records.
  • Types a variety of technical and non-technical documents such as correspondence, reports, minutes of meetings, medical billings, statements and forms from draft and/or dictation; composes correspondence as directed.
  • Performs clerical duties such as answering the telephone, taking and relaying messages, re-directing calls to the appropriate department, responding to general inquiries, maintaining supplies, preparing requisitions for signature, and collecting and distributing mail.
  • Maintains and updates various records including department activities and statistics and prepares related summary reports.
  • Provides patients with invoices for materials/supplies purchased, according to established guidelines. As required, collects monies and issues appropriate receipts, submitting monies and documentation to the Accounts Receivable Department.
  • Arranges meetings as directed, books meeting rooms, types and circulates notices and agendas. Records, transcribes and distributes minutes of meetings. Maintains appointment calendar for program as required.
  • Performs timekeeping by completing payroll sheets, entering payroll information into the computerized system, submitting to payroll and processing payroll corrections as necessary.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Education and Experience

Grade 12 and two years' recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to keyboard at 45 wpm.
  • Knowledge of medical terminology.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

title: Chargé de projet fiabilité
description:
Site Name: Canada - Quebec - Quebec
Posted Date: Apr 22 2022


Chargé de projet fiabilité

Objectifs du poste :

Le chargé de projet Fiabilité est responsable de tous les projets qui lui sont attribués (étendue, budget et échéanciers). Il travaille à optimiser la disponibilité opérationnelle des équipements dans un cadre de qualité, d’approvisionnement et de réduction de coûts, Il met en place les moyens nécessaires pour maximiser le cycle de vie des actifs et aussi assure le maintien d’un parc d’équipements/systèmes en bonnes conditions.

Le chargé de projet Fiabilité représente le département ou d’autres départements afin d’assurer un choix éclairer des équipements/systèmes et d’en assurer une maintenabilité optimale.

Exigences

  • Baccalauréat en génie mécanique ou tout autre domaine pertinent.
  • 3 à 5 années d’expérience en gestion de projets liés à la fiabilité des équipements et/ou ingénieur fiabiliste
  • Membre de l’Ordre des ingénieurs
  • Bilingue (français et anglais)
  • Expérience dans l’analyse des défaillances d’équipement et résolution de problèmes.
  • Connaissance de la maintenance productive totale (TPM)

Principales responsabilités :

  • Gérer tous les aspects de ses projets de la définition du projet à son implantation en passant par la réalisation. Il est ainsi responsable de l’étendue, des livrables, des ressources, de l’échéancier et du budget de ses projets.
  • Planifier, superviser et/ou réaliser et finaliser les documents techniques nécessaires dans le cadre de ses projets (procédures, protocoles, rapports, etc.).
  • Diriger ou participer, selon le montant du contrat à octroyer, aux appels d’offres, à la négociation et à l’analyse des soumissions et choisir le soumissionnaire retenu.
  • Assurer la gestion matricielle des ressources incluant les consultants ou sous-traitants assignés à ses projets. Pour les ressources externes, évaluer et gérer le travail de ceux-ci.
  • Réaliser un bilan de santé des équipements du site et propose des moyens pour optimiser leur disponibilité en investiguant les bris et en identifiant les causes racines à l’aide des outils existants ou en les développant.
  • Participer à l’élaboration du portrait court, moyen et long terme de la santé du parc des équipements/systèmes afin de permettre la priorisation des investissements en fonction d’une gestion des risques.
  • Participer à la planification et propositions de divers projets d’amélioration et d’optimisation.
  • Implanter sur le terrain des outils de mesure et une méthodologie centrée sur la rentabilité et la disponibilité de l’équipement. (MTTR, MTBF, etc) et participe à l’élaboration et l’implantation d’indicateurs de performance clés.
  • Agir comme représentant technique – Fiabilité dans, entre autres, le processus de conception et de développement des équipements afin d’assurer une maintenabilité optimale (FMEA, RCM), dans les divers projets et dans le réseau GSK Vaccin en tant que point de contact en fiabilité pour le site de Ste-Foy

Avantages du poste

  • Salaire: À déterminer selon l’expérience
  • Horaire: Du lundi au vendredi de jour – (37,5 heure/semaine)
  • Statut: Permanent
  • Cafétéria sur place
  • Gym gratuit pour les employés
  • Accessible en transport en commun

  • LI-GSK

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: newTechnical Support Specialist (L1)
description:
*Flexible Work From Home/In Office*

The Company

Think Research is changing the way healthcare is delivered - we are a global SaaS company that delivers the latest clinical knowledge to the point-of-care in hospitals, seniors care homes and in the community. The body of global medical research grows exponentially every day. It’s impossible for doctors to keep all of the latest best-practices in their heads so we make software that brings it to their fingertips, organizing medical knowledge and data to improve patient care. We're a fast-growing publicly traded company (in 2800 healthcare facilities and counting) and we’re making a global impact with a footprint in seven countries. If you are looking to improve patient care and are passionate about technology — look no further.

Why Us?

  • It's not every day that you have the chance to change the way your friends and family are cared for - Make an impact!
  • Be a part of the digital disruption happening in healthcare and do challenging, meaningful work
  • We’re growing, and so will you with leaders who will support your development through mentorship and other opportunities
  • Collaborative, creative, dynamic and flexible work environment, with a start-up spirit

The Role

We are seeking a bright, detail oriented, and highly motivated individual to join our Technical Services team as a Technical Support Specialist. The ideal candidate must be a quick learner, a problem solver, have a lot of patience, and have great communication and organization skills.

You Will Have The Opportunity To:

  • Field incoming technical support requests from client via both telephone, email, self-service, web and resolve issues in a timely manner
  • Review documents, workflow and plans for support with customers/vendors
  • Update and maintain documents within a structured knowledge3 base
  • Coordinate monitoring and tracking of issues and resolutions in our centralized ITSM support tool.
  • Conduct configuration changes in client platform instances
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues in regards to interface and information exchanges
  • Provide status updates and reports on current state of issues
  • Manage and action all the IT alerts on time
  • Able to monitor and diagnose application and infrastructure programs
  • Perform timely technical and management escalations for outstanding issues and service requests.
  • Able to work on IT related projects and roll-outs
  • Work shifts and be available for rotating off-hours and on-call duties
  • Ensure the KPI targets are met on every month
  • Learn something new using PD days and apply the knowledge at work.

What You Will Bring:

  • 1-3+ years experience in Technical Support environment
  • Post secondary degree in computer science or a related field
  • Proven troubleshooting and problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Experience working with SQL scripting, ADFS, JSON, .NET, .IIS, ACS and HL7 would be considered an asset
  • Previous experience working with SaaS solutions is an asset
  • The ability to communicate technical information to a non-technical audience
  • Team player - able to learn from and share knowledge with others and has the capability to work independently
  • Proven ability to multitask in a fun, fast-paced team environment while at the same time maintaining a professional relationship with our clients.
  • Self-motivated and resourceful with good interpersonal skills.

Subject to applicable laws and regulations, Think Research vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter a Think Research or subsidiary office/clinic.

Think Research and all subsidiaries are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, free of discrimination and harassment.

We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

We are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Should you require an accommodation, we would like to work with you to meet your needs.

title: newReg Ortho Technician
description:
Union: UNIFOR Service

Location: KW Campus

Work Type: Part Time

Shift: 7.5 hour shifts Monday to Friday, Days

Summary:
To assist orthopedic, plastic, emergency and family doctors in the care and management of their patients. Assist both inpatients and outpatients. Responsibilities include: cast work, application of splints and sterile procedures such as suture removal, dressing changes and pin/screw removals. Contributes to ensuring there is a safe environment for patients, staff and visitors.

Qualifications:

  • Successful completion of orthopedic technician diploma course
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Required to obtain CSOT membership
  • Must demonstrate willingness to become CSOT certified within 2 years
  • High level of initiative and self-direction required as well as strong organizational skills
  • Aseptic technique required
  • Recent orthopedic or fracture room experience preferred
  • Able to work in fast paced environment with rapid turnover and conflicting priorities
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment is essential
  • Must be able to perform duties efficiently under limited supervision
  • Good attendance record


'

As part of our commitment to the health and safety of our patients, staff and community from COVID-19, subject to any accommodation required by applicable human rights legislation, Grand River Hospital requires that all staff have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

APPLICATIONS WILL BE RECEIVED UNTIL THE POSTING IS CLOSED.

Please include a resume with your application in order to ensure that your qualifications are appropriately considered in the hiring process.

Grand River Hospital is committed to fair and equitable employment and in our recruitment and selection practices. We strongly believe in inclusion and diversity within our organization, and welcome all applicants including, but not limited to: racialized communities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, Indigenous people, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of our Hospital community. We are committed to providing and fostering a respectful workplace for all employees, free from violence and harassment. Grand River Hospital is a proud member of the Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion (CCDI).

Upon individual request, the hospital will endeavour to remove any barrier to the hiring process to accommodate candidates, including those with disabilities. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application, interview or selection processes, please contact Human Resources in advance for assistance.

title: Veterinary Receptionist
description:
MARITIME ANIMAL HOSPITAL is looking for a full-time veterinary receptionist to join our team. Our privately owned, 5 doctor small animal practice is located in Moncton, NB.

We offer competitive wages, uniform allowances, medical benefits and a generous pet discount for your own pets. Our practice is open Monday-Saturday.

Our veterinary receptionists are busy- they greet our clients & pets, answer the phone, book appointments, process invoices, help clients with food and medication and generally keep the front desk running smoothly. This position requires someone who is organized, has an upbeat attitude and a willingness to learn.

The successful applicant must have graduated from a veterinary training program or have a minimum of 1 year experience in a veterinary setting.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • Veterinary Assistant: 1 year (preferred)
  • Veterinary Receptionist: 1 year (preferred)
