title: Scientific Advisor (12 Months)
description:
Site Name: Canada - Ontario - Mississauga
Posted Date: Apr 21 2022


JOB PURPOSE:

The Scientific Advisor within Medical Affairs will be responsible for providing expert scientific capability and leadership while managing a broad range of Medical Affairs activities associated with their assigned products and therapy area;

  • This role will require the individual to represent the med affairs function as part of the Respiratory cross functional team, engaging key external and internal stakeholders
  • The individual will be responsible strategic decision and guidance with regards the development of the respiratory biologic portfolio.
  • They will evaluate and support development and implement local research strategies to address data gaps and advance the scientific/clinical understanding of GSK medicines
  • They will be accountable for leading external scientific/clinical exchange with the scientific and medical community and to bring the medical voice of the customer back into the organization (includes 1:1 interaction, advisory boards, medical education, congress presentations, publications and congress sponsorships).
  • They will work with the Medical team, the cross-functional teams, and global teams providing scientific/clinical expertise, advice and technical leadership on GSK products in the Canadian market by developing and implementing a local, integrated medical strategy and customer engagement plans.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide expert scientific product and disease knowledge and trusted medical leadership to GSK Canada and to above country Medical Networks
  • Build and leverage high quality scientific knowledge and capability expertise across the enterprise in collaboration with Medical Strategic Operations and Capability Excellence
  • Deliver external engagement excellence characterized by timely, responsible and responsive interactions with the external medical and scientific community to achieve a two-way trusted scientific partnership
  • Accountable for regular review and analysis of data analytics and medical voice of customer to derive insights and develop action plans to deliver on the medical strategy
  • Lead, develop and implement a local Medical Strategic Plan for medicines within assigned therapy area including:
    • Identifying areas of research interest and developing timely local study protocols which advance the scientific understanding of our medications
    • Identifying areas of medical education interest
    • Identifying advisory board/1:1 interaction needs and leading their implementation and follow-up.
    • Ensuring alignment with commercial strategic planning
    • Managing research budget and budget forecasting processes for assigned products and therapy areas

  • Evaluate investigator-sponsored studies to advance research on disease and its treatment, aligned to the areas of research interest
  • Deliver study reports and local publications related to local research activities
  • Support the TA Director in the review of all medical grant and donation requests (including Independent Medical Education requests) and congress sponsorship requests to ensure alignment with therapy area strategies.
  • Lead the development and implementation of advice seeking interactions (e.g. 1:1 interaction, advisory boards)
  • Accountable for the management of therapy aligned medical content to deliver on the Global HCP Engagement Initiative
  • Leverage medical and scientific knowledge to ensure that all materials produced are medically and scientifically accurate and in compliance with local and GSK requirements

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Ability to apply scientific knowledge and lead research programs
  • Must possess a good understanding of the Canadian healthcare environment
  • Ability to manage relationships with internal and external partners including Key External Experts and global stakeholders
  • Strong ability to leverage scientific knowledge
  • Strong ability to develop timely and meaningful research protocols and study reports
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills are essential
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills and problem-solving capabilities

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Advanced post graduate scientific degree (MD, PhD, PharmD)
  • Industry Medical Affairs experience– with specific experience in Respiratory
  • Demonstrated ability to work as a strategic partner with commercial functions
  • Solid project management skills
  • Strong business and financial acumen

  • LI-GSK

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Safety Assistant - Infectious Disease Prevention & Managemen...
description:
Req ID: 117900
Location: Flexible within the Western Zone (Bridgewater, Yarmouth, Digby and Kentville)
Company: NSHA
Department: PS CZ Infectious Disease
Type of Employment: Regular Hourly FT (100% FTE) x 1 position(s)
Status: position
Posting Closing Date: 15-May-22


Applications are accepted until 11:59 PM on the Closing Date.

Nova Scotia Health Authority is the largest provider of health services in Nova Scotia. We are over 22,000 employees who provide health care and support services in hospitals, health centres and community-based programs throughout Nova Scotia.

Nova Scotia Health Authority provides health services to Nova Scotians and some specialized services to Maritimers and Atlantic Canadians. We operate hospitals, health centres and community-based programs across the province. Our team of health professionals includes employees, doctors, researchers, learners and volunteers that provide the health care or services you may need. This is accomplished across four geographic management zones which are responsible for the operation of acute care health centres and the provision of a variety of inpatient, outpatient services including academic, tertiary, quaternary care and community-based programs and services including continuing care, primary health care, public health, and mental health and addictions.

Responsibilities

Under the direction of the Manager, Infectious Disease Prevention & Management the Safety Assistant provides confidential support to the IDMP team. Activities supported include: pre-placement health assessment, communicable disease prevention and management, medical surveillance, health promotion, respiratory protection (FIT testing) education and training.

Qualifications

  • Post-Secondary diploma in Occupational Health & Safety, or a related field.
  • Undergraduate degree is an asset.
  • Excellent computer skills; familiar with enterprise software systems; proficient in the use of Microsoft Office applications including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint.
  • Well-developed abilities and skills in modern office practices.
  • Demonstrated strong organizational and team skills with emphasis on decision making, problem solving, motivational and communication skills.
  • Ability to effectively determine day-to-day priorities and utilize foresight to ensure appropriate activities for self and recommendations for team members.
  • Ability to work effectively during periods of high activity and with varying personality styles and tasks. Demonstrates resilience and maintains effectiveness. Flexible in creating and suggesting alternative solutions to meet goals.
  • Excellent verbal and written skills. Ability to effectively meet and communicate in situations requiring tact and poise. Proficiency in drafting detailed procedures, letters, reports, etc.
  • Actively listens and conveys understanding of customers’ requests such that their needs can be anticipated and satisfied. Well-developed abilities with respect to problem solving required.

Additional qualifications

  • Competencies in other languages an asset, French preferred

Successful external applicants are required to provide a criminal record check (including Vulnerable Sector Search) to People Services before starting employment and assume any associated costs as a condition of employment.

Hours of Work

  • Permanent, Full-time position; 75 hours bi-weekly

Flexible within the Western Zone (Bridgewater, Yarmouth, Digby and Kentville)

Salary Information

$20.6437 - $25.8046/hourly


Thank you for your interest in this position. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Typically interviews are held within three to four weeks of the closing date. Successful external applicants will be required to submit the below documents and assume any associated costs, as a condition of employment. Additional documentation such as banking & proof of identity will be included in your offer letter.

  • Criminal Record Check
  • Proof of education & training certifications
  • Proof of any additional required qualification
  • Valid Registration with the relevant licensing body
  • Submission of immunization record along with health assessment documentation
  • Proof of SIN number

Hiring Process will depend on the timeliness of delivering the above. Nova Scotia Health Authority is proud to provide a smoke free and scent free environment.

Nova Scotia Health Authority (NSHA) is committed to being a workforce that is free of discrimination, values diversity and is representative, at all job levels, of the people we serve. Our priority groups are Aboriginal People, African Nova Scotians, Persons with Disabilities and Recent Immigrants. Members of these groups are welcome to apply and self-identify if they wish to be considered under our Employment Equity policy. Only online applications are accepted.

title: Marketing Associate - Biotechnology - 12 month contract
description:
Site Name: Canada - Ontario - Mississauga, Canada – Quebec – Montréal, Saint Laurent Montreal
Posted Date: Apr 18 2022


Required Strengths: Project Management / Team Player/ Self Starter

The Marketing Associate will play a key role on a growing oncology team that strives to deliver value to patients, Healthcare Professionals and GSK. This individual will be self starter that can drive projects forward and effectively work with team members. This successful candidate will support both in line and launch brands and will work closely with the sales team so it will provide range of experiences within pharma commercial teams. Responsibilities include supporting development of sales and training tools, managing key projects for the oncology team and integrating key initiatives around performance and innovation.

In this position you may participate in:

  • Develop and execute marketing and training materials for both sales force and customer facing programs in alignment with brand strategy
  • Organize and plan day-to-day touchpoints within the oncology business division
  • Play a project management role in the brand planning process including business review, strategy development and operational plans
  • Assist the Marketing team in the logistics of National / Regional conference planning
  • Help the Marketing team in planning and executing National / Regional advisory board activities
  • Support Product Manager in on-going analysis of the competitive environment that have potential impact to business and support relevant action plans to address opportunities or gaps

Qualifications required:

  • University degree in Marketing, Business or Health Sciences and perferably working towards or recently completed a Masters’ degree
  • General knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry is required
  • Self-starter who takes initiative and is a strategic and solution-oriented thinker
  • Creative, persuasive individual who works well in a team environment
  • Proven ability to deal with ambiguity, requiring agility and flexibility to deliver on tasks at hand
  • Results oriented with a proven ability to manage projects, prioritize work, and meet challenging deadlines.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills necessary to interface with external, internal and GSK customers/stakeholders in a matrix environment (responsiveness, “how can we” attitude, tact, ability to facilitate group meetings).
  • Clear and concise, verbal and written communication skills including active listening, summarizing, probing, clarifying.\
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bilingual (French & English) is an asset
  • Interest and/or experience in marketing

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Lead Client Care Representative
description:
Royal York Animal Hospital is a busy, progressive, multi doctor practice located in Etobicoke (Dundas just east of Royal York Rd). We are proudly AAHA accredited, Certified Cat Friendly hospital and all of our medical team is FEAR FREE certified. RYAH provides a good work environment that promotes personal and professional growth – which allows our team to deliver a high level and high standard of medicine.

Position Description: Lead Client Care Representative

Position Overview: The role of the Lead Client Care Representative (CCR) is to strengthen the human-animal veterinary bond through exceptional care. Your role is vital to the success of our hospital as you manage the flow of appointments and create and uphold the client experience standards within the VCC team. As the VCC lead you will create a positive, supportive environment for your team where they can grow and learn. You will assist in hiring, coaching and mentoring CCR staff. You will work collaboratively with other leads to ensure the hospital is profitable.

Reporting Structure: This position reports to the Practice Manager.

Educational Requirements:

High school diploma is required.

1-year leadership or project management experience is required

1-year experience in an animal clinic environment is required

Previous customer service experience is required.

Skills:

Excellent CCR – Strong client focus, highly organized, collaborative. Successful coaching, and mentoring skills. Excellent written and oral communication skills.

Duties:

The Lead Client Care Representative will dedicate the majority of their scheduled hours to performance of CCR duties. Other tasks the Lead CCR will perform include, but are not limited to: Management of the CCR staff to ensure:

a) The hospital is adequately supported (scheduling)

b) A high level of client care is achieved

c) Adequate training has been provided for CCR staff (new and existing)

Administrative duties including:

a. Manage the appointment book

b. Manage Accounts Receivable

c. Cash Management/balancing of daily transactions

d. Appearance of the reception area and maintenance of office equipment

The role of the lead CCR is one that is meant to foster a positive environment of teamwork and collaboration. The Lead CCR will solicit the feedback of his/her peers to assist in developing a mutually respectful environment

About Us

Royal York Animal Hospital is part of the VetStrategy group of clinics. VetStrategy is a 100% Canadian operated group of veterinary clinics with locations throughout Canada. We believe that veterinary clinics are an integral part of the community they serve and as such we put a large focus on community-based activities and initiatives. Every clinic we partner with is unique and serves a very diverse client base.

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Friendly and supportive work environment
  • Mentorship
  • Comprehensive benefit plan including medical/dental coverage
  • Competitive compensation
  • Access to Animal Care Technology online training
  • Opportunity to advance in your career and career planning
  • Commitment to the community and to helping pets in need
  • Competitive medical and pet supply discounts
  • Canada wide internal transfer opportunities

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
We are offering many services curbside, masks are required for staff and customers entering the building.

Experience:

  • Leadership: 1 year (required)
  • animal hospital: 1 year (preferred)
  • Customer service: 1 year (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-04-04

title: Epic EHR At-The-Elbow (ATE) Support
company: HQ Resources on behalf of Client
description:
HQ Resources Canada on behalf of our Client

Position: Epic EHR At-The-Elbow Support (training provided!)

The Opportunity:

We are currently recruiting for the position of Epic EHR At-The-Elbow Support, to be a part of an exciting project for our client in the healthcare sector (Hamilton Health Sciences). Reporting to a Designated Manager, you will be responsible for training and providing EHR system support to end-users.

Location: Hamilton (On-site)

Job type: Contract Temporary (Short-term)

Duration: 2-to-5-weeks (12-hour Shift)

Start Date: June 4, 2022

Training period: May 30, 2022, to June 2, 2022

Benefits: Competitive pay & paid training

What you’ll be responsible for:

  • Will train on and provide EHR system support to end-users via person-to-person interaction with Doctors, Nurses, Techs, Receptionists, etc.
  • Instructs users on log-in procedures, navigation, and data entry procedures
  • Performs role-based and specialty-specific instruction as needed
  • Reports to a Designated Manager on outcomes of all support shifts
  • Provides input for on-going supported user proficiency as needed
  • Assists with team logistics and facilitates support coverage as needed

What you bring:

  • Strong Technical Aptitude
  • Experience using and navigating IT technology
  • Attention to detail, patience, and a positive, customer centric attitude
  • Strong verbal, written communications, and interpersonal skills
  • Willingness to train and learn the use and function of an Electronic Health Record (EHR) system
  • Demonstrated ability to develop proficiency with unfamiliar toolsets
  • Ability to work twelve hour shifts over a 2-to-5-week period
  • Ability and willingness to stand for long durations
  • Willingness to train and learn the use and function of an Electronic Health Record (EHR) system

Preferred, but not required:

  • 1 year of experience providing application support and professional services in a healthcare specialty, business, education, or relevant field
  • At least 1 year of experience in troubleshooting windows workstations including network and operating systems
  • Experience working in, or closely with, ambulatory medical care clinics and experience working with physicians
  • Prior Knowledge of Electronic Medical Record systems, Registration, Scheduling, Billing,

Transcription, EMPI, ADT, or other clinical and ancillary systems utilized in hospitals and physician practices

  • Experience working with and managing colleagues in a matrix-management model is helpful

Application Procedure:

Interested candidates, please reach out via email to the address noted.

**Note: Proof of Covid vaccination and booster shot required prior to any on-site work**

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal
Contract length: 2-5 weeks

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
*Note: Proof of Covid vaccination and booster shot required prior to any on-site work*

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Hamilton, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

  • Do you have prior knowledge of Electronic Medical Record systems, Registration, Scheduling, Billing, Transcription, EMPI, ADT, or other clinical and ancillary systems utilized in hospitals and physician practices?
  • Are you available for both the training period AND position duration as explained?

Experience:

  • providing application support: 1 year (preferred)
  • troubleshooting Windows workstations: 1 year (preferred)
  • working in, or closely with, ambulatory medical care clinics: 1 year (preferred)
  • working in or with, ambulatory medical care clinics: 1 year (preferred)
  • working with physicians: 1 year (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-30

title: Innovation and Virtual Sales Manager
description:
Site Name: Canada - Ontario - Mississauga, Canada – Quebec – Montréal
Posted Date: Mar 28 2022


[Version française en dessous]

The Innovation and Virtual Sales Manager must lead a team of 9-12 Virtual Sales representatives to drive

performance across Canada while upholding the highest standards of good governance. This

role provides the opportunity to develop coaching, strategic thinking and senior stakeholder management

capabilities. It is also an entrepreneurial role requiring the creativity and attitude of a start-up, and an urgency to drive change in an area of the business that is fast evolving. You will have a driver’s seat in shaping how we engage with customers virtually in this new normal.

Customer facing responsibilities:

  • Lead a team of CSO Sales professionals to deliver to vendor commitment, in alignment with GSK requirements
  • Drive performance, ensure accountability to results of designated promoted brands
  • Manage relationship with third party vendor to ensure compliance to all Canadian and GSK
  • laws and policies
  • Translate strategy into action and align strategy with goal-setting, execution and performance measurement
  • Work with Business Units, Marketing and Sales Teams to determine strategic and tactical priorities for the Virtual Sales Team

Innovation responsibilities:

  • Lead the strategy development, management, and execution of innovative virtual engagement tactics
  • Develop innovative solutions in a challenging environment to optimally engage with HCPs and consumers to bring value in a different way
  • Manage partnerships / engagement with external customers
  • Lead and provide direction to 3rd party support services such as analytics, marketing and strategy consultants

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 5 years of relevant business experience
  • 2 years of solid people management skills and/or coaching experience
  • Exceptional leadership skills and teamwork abilities with cross functional partners
  • Inspiring business acumen demonstrated by the ability to set a vision, develop and execute a comprehensive, innovative and strategic plan
  • Strong track record of delivering results in a quick-changing and high-energy environment, while effectively managing competing priorities
  • Outstanding interpersonal, communication (written & verbal), presentation and influencing skills
  • Excellent communication skills, including strong presentation and facilitation skills to explain/sell creative concepts
  • Valid driver's license*

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Firm understanding of the unique pharmaceutical market, customer, patient, and health care system
  • Out-of-the-box thinker and demonstrated entrepreneurial mindset
  • Expert knowledge of the territory and organization analysis
  • Mastery of selling skills
  • Proficiency with Excel and analytics tools

  • This position allows for the provision of a company – leased vehicle. However, to be eligible for this

position and a company vehicle, GSK will need to obtain acceptable results from a license verification

inquiry and drivers abstract review against its safe driver program requirements.

Please note that only candidates meeting the above-mentioned requirements will be contacted for an

interview. In the event where the number of qualified candidates vastly exceeds the number of vacancies,

the candidates’ leadership team will be contacted to help rank candidates. Only top candidates are to be

interviewed.

[Version française]

Le chef des ventes virtuelles et de l’innovation dirigera une équipe de 9 à 12 représentants des ventes virtuelles pour stimuler le rendement partout au Canada tout en respectant les normes les plus élevées en matière de bonne gouvernance. Le candidat choisi aura l’occasion de mettre en valeur ses capacités en matière d’encadrement, de réflexion stratégique et de gestion d’intervenants de haut niveau. Il s’agit également d’un rôle entrepreneurial qui exige la créativité et la mentalité d’une entreprise en démarrage, ainsi que le sens de l’urgence de susciter des changements dans un secteur de l’entreprise qui évolue rapidement. Le candidat choisi aura le pouvoir de façonner la manière dont l’entreprise interagit avec les clients virtuellement dans le cadre de cette nouvelle réalité.

Responsabilités liées aux relations avec les clients :

  • Diriger une équipe de professionnels des ventes de la CSMO en veillant au respect des engagements des fournisseurs, conformément aux exigences de GSK
  • Dynamiser le rendement, assurer la responsabilisation à l’égard des résultats des marques faisant l’objet d’une promotion déterminée
  • Gérer les relations avec un fournisseur tiers afin d’assurer le respect de toutes les lois et politiques canadiennes et de GSK
  • Transformer la stratégie en action et l’harmoniser sur l’établissement des objectifs, l’exécution et la mesure du rendement
  • Collaborer avec les unités commerciales, les équipes Marketing et Ventes pour déterminer les priorités stratégiques et tactiques de l’équipe Ventes virtuelles

Responsabilités en matière d’innovation :

  • Diriger l’élaboration de la stratégie, la gestion et l’exécution de tactiques d’engagement virtuelles novatrices
  • Élaborer des solutions innovantes dans un environnement stimulant afin de mobiliser de manière optimale les professionnels de la santé et les consommateurs pour apporter de la valeur d’une manière différente
  • Gérer les partenariats et les engagements avec les clients externes
  • Diriger et orienter les services de soutien d’une tierce partie, comme les experts-conseils en analyse, en marketing et en stratégie

COMPÉTENCES DE BASE

  • Diplôme universitaire de premier cycle
  • Cinq ans d’expérience pertinente dans le milieu des affaires
  • Deux ans d’expérience solide en gestion du personnel et/ou en encadrement
  • Compétences en matière de leadership et capacité de travail en équipe exceptionnelle avec des partenaires interfonctionnels
  • Sens aigu des affaires démontré par la capacité à définir une vision, à élaborer et à exécuter un plan stratégique, intégré et novateur
  • Excellente réputation en matière de résultats obtenus dans un milieu dynamique et en constante évolution, tout en gérant efficacement les priorités concurrentielles
  • Aptitudes exceptionnelles en matière de relations interpersonnelles, de communication (écrite et orale), de présentation et d’influence
  • Excellentes compétences dans le domaine de la communication, y compris de solides aptitudes en présentation et en animation pour expliquer et vendre des concepts novateurs
  • Permis de conduire valide*

Atouts :

  • Compréhension approfondie du marché unique du secteur pharmaceutique, des clients, des patients et du système de santé
  • Capacité à sortir des sentiers battus et esprit d’entreprise
  • Connaissance approfondie du territoire et capacité d’analyse organisationnelle
  • Maîtrise des techniques de vente
  • Maîtrise d’Excel et des outils d’analyse

  • La personne qui occupe ce poste pourra bénéficier d’un véhicule de fonction. Toutefois, pour être admissible à ce poste et à un véhicule de fonction, vous devrez fournir à GSK des résultats acceptables d’une demande de vérification de permis et d’un examen du dossier de conducteur par rapport aux exigences du programme en matière de conduite sécuritaire.

Veuillez noter que seuls les candidats qui satisfont aux exigences susmentionnées seront convoqués en entrevue. Si le nombre de candidats qualifiés dépasse largement le nombre de postes vacants, l’équipe de direction du recrutement sera contactée pour classer les candidats. Seuls les candidats les mieux classés seront alors convoqués en entrevue.

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Manager, Business Operations
description:
The Company

Think Research is changing the way healthcare is delivered - we are a global SaaS company that delivers the latest clinical knowledge to the point-of-care in hospitals, seniors care homes and in the community. The body of global medical research grows exponentially every day. It’s impossible for doctors to keep all of the latest best-practices in their heads so we make software that brings it to their fingertips, organizing medical knowledge and data to improve patient care. We're a fast-growing publicly traded company (in 2800 healthcare facilities and counting) and we’re making a global impact with a footprint in seven countries. If you are looking to improve patient care and are passionate about technology — look no further.

Why Us?

  • It's not every day that you have the chance to change the way your friends and family are cared for - Make an impact!
  • Be a part of the digital disruption happening in healthcare and do challenging, meaningful work
  • We’re growing, and so will you with leaders who will support your development through mentorship and other opportunities
  • Collaborative, creative, dynamic and flexible work environment, with a start-up spirit

The Role

Join Think Research as our newest Manager, Business Operations! Oversee and drive company-wide strategic goals, business transformation, optimization and performance.

You Will Have The Opportunity To

Strategy and communication

  • Oversee and drive company-wide strategic goal (OKR) and scorecard planning, implementation and tracking, to ensure achievement of objectives and relevant KPIs
  • Manage the corporate cadence and communication flow
    • Meeting rhythm - ensure the smooth operation of the organization’s meeting rhythm. Coordinate, run and develop content for management and all-hands meetings
    • Reporting - Monitor benchmarks and performance data. Manage business line and functional team performance reporting across the organization.
  • Proactively review and analyze processes, operations and KPIs to identify opportunities for improvement
  • Manage and create internal communications to ensure company-wide alignment on priorities and corporate strategy

Business Optimization and Performance

  • Identifying opportunities to streamline processes and reduce costs.
  • Support strategic business transformation projects
  • Analyze company performance reporting and data and provide actionable insights to internal stakeholders, including company executives.
  • Act as an internal consultant for the company, leading all project phases
  • Proactively review and analyze end to end processes and KPIs to identify opportunities for continuous improvement and/or cost efficiency.

Business Operations

  • Support the integration of physical workspaces for acquired entities
  • Manage leases and real estate including assigned projects
  • Manage TRC group of companies insurance policies and programs
  • Lead future real estate projects for organization
  • Manage third party vendor management program including vendor rationalization programs
  • Manage and provide support on corporate tools such as Salesforce and Slack.

What You Will Bring:

  • Post-secondary degree in a related field of study
  • 5 years experience in operations leadership preferably in a healthcare/technology environment
  • Project Management and/or Lean Six Sigma certification preferred
  • Proven ability to achieve business results in a fast-paced, multi-function environment.
  • Creative problem solver with demonstrated results in improving operational processes.
  • Ability to leverage data to surface opportunities for business process and service improvements.
  • Proven ability to develop creative solutions that result in measurable cost reductions
  • Strong collaboration skills and demonstrated ability to influence and execute effectively in a cross-functional environment.
  • Impeccable organization skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to apply effective change management principles and consider the human element of change.
  • Excellent presentation, written, and verbal communication skills.
  • Must be a high-integrity, team player with the flexibility to meet the demands of changing business priorities.

Think Research and all subsidiaries are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, free of discrimination and harassment.

We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

We are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Should you require an accommodation, we would like to work with you to meet your needs.

title: LOC Quality Team Lead, Consumer Healthcare
description:
Site Name: Mississauga Standish Court
Posted Date: Apr 1 2022


Why Consumer Healthcare?


Right now, we’re on an incredible journey as we prepare to become the first independent, 100% focused consumer healthcare company. We’re doing this at a time when the work we do has never mattered more. Better everyday health is about improving the health and wellness of the consumers that we touch every year – over a billion and a half of them – and it goes beyond products. It’s about truly helping people manage their health proactively in different ways as consumer needs evolve.


With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.


This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion


In Consumer Healthcare we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.


We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.

JOB PURPOSE:

Ensure LOC Quality processes and systems are in-use for activities carried out across the Local Operating Company (LOC) ensuring as well that they are executed in compliance with GSK standards and policies, GxP and regulatory requirements.

The function is critical to the effective execution of processes and systems that are crucial or have a direct impact to product quality, regulatory compliance and product supply. The job holder is expected to manage and oversee operational quality activities within the LOC. This includes end to end product lifecycle management through support of innovation and product launch, batch disposition and change management.

Using an active customer and consumer focused mindset, the LOC Quality Team Lead will generate creative solutions for technical problems while maintaining adherence to GSK values and expectations. They will drive operational team performance, with a continuous improvement mindset.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Ensure LOC Quality processes and systems are in-use for activities carried out across the LOC ensuring as well that they are compliant with GSK standards and policies, GxP and regulatory requirements. These processes and systems would relate to, but are not limited to:

  • Acting as primary LOC supply chain point of contact ensuring supply chain product needs are appropriately prioritized within Quality Operations team, and that release turn-around times and measures to support OTIF are in place, measurable and monitored to drive performance.
  • Manage operational Quality team support for commercial business to provide input, expertise and problem solving for new product introductions and/or changes to existing products and manufacturing sites.
  • Batch management & Release to Market: Lead batch assessment and release activities for all API, bulks, intermediates, repacks and finished product as applicable, to ensure releases are carried out efficiently, in a timely manner, that they meet relevant regulatory standards and support local business requirements.
    • Oversee all Duty of Care activities and act as Quality Person responsible for release of product to the local market.
    • Ensure investigations and root cause analysis are conducted in accordance with procedure, are supported by team in a timely manner, and manage resolution of Quality-related issues arising from operational activities with LOC Quality Lead, Logistic Services Provider (LSPs) and supplying sites.
    • Ensure application of robust quality hold process as required for product issues, ensuring control internally and at 3rd party service providers as required.
    • Where applicable, ensure timely local Quality release of imported finished goods deliveries.
    • Develop systems and processes to monitor performance and drive continuous improvement. Apply comprehensive data analytics through business intelligence system(s) to measure and drive performance and team workload.

  • Local Repacking: Oversee all matters pertaining to GxP, Regulatory and QMS compliance for repacking processes to ensure timely QA approval before initiating any re-packing activity as well as to ensure timely Quality batch release of repacked orders before distribution. Ensure documentation of batch records including repack protocol and retention of samples, where applicable. Engage cross-functionally with Quality Compliance to ensure robust, compliant repacking process is in place locally and with 3rd party service providers.
  • ERP and Systems: Key Lead resource responsible for ensuring that operational systems are robust, fit for purpose and implemented appropriately within the LOC. Ensure standard, consistent routine in-use performance supported by SOPs and WIs as required.
  • Responsible for ensuring products comply with specification, registered details and that LOC review of specifications for regulated products is conducted and any issues are escalated and addressed.
  • Overall responsibility for ensuring that regulated requirements including identity testing, annual confirmatory testing, unique identification and full batch record review are conducted in a timely manner.
  • Ensure appropriate management of identified temperature excursions inbound and in-market within the Canada supply chain. Support LOC Quality Manager to ensure robust investigations are conducted where required and product dispositions are documented and supported.
  • Act as operational quality subject matter expert to support above-site and regulatory agency inspections of the LOC quality unit in relation to GxP operations.
  • Drive robust monthly management review process within LOC Quality unit, ensuring team engagement, quality culture mindset and driving knowledge and capability improvements.
  • Assist local market Quality & Regulatory Intelligence process by assessing impact of emerging regulations and providing input to LOC Quality Compliance team as requested. Provide insight to external advocacy groups to assist in aligning industry position.
  • Manage and oversee the LOC establishment licensing process within the team, ensuring licenses remain current, compliant and any submitted renewals, applications and/or amendments are submitted in a timely manner and supported by appropriate evidence.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:


  • Quality experience within the industry, and application of Quality Systems & Quality Operations
  • Bachelor's degree in business or a related field
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience within the Pharmaceutical / Consumer Healthcare industries, preferably in the capacity of a quality specialist or a manager.
  • Knowledge of regulatory requirements pertaining to GMP.
  • Understanding of and experience in quality assurance systems particularly in the areas of batch release, product incidents, artwork control, change management and post-market surveillance.
  • Knowledge on effective quality documentation systems.
  • Bachelor's degree in business or a related field

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Professional written and verbal communication skills. Able to deliver positive and proactive communications and foster excellent working relationships with stakeholders at any level of the organization
  • Ability to influence and motivate stakeholders at any level of the LOC organization
  • Analytical mind, good attention to detail and problem-solving skills within a structured process
  • Good team player – works well in cross-functional teams
  • Good time management skills, with ability to multi-task and work under pressure
  • Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills
  • Concise and persuasive in the description of the different QA situations. Able to stick to the standard and not be pressurized.
  • Works with a spirit of continuous improvement and innovation, creatively open to new ideas and methods
  • Flexible thinking – able to challenge and see views from different perspectives
  • Ability to self-motivate and be resilient and focused under pressure
  • Able to work effectively in English
  • Strong general computer literacy with Intermediate skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook

  • LI-GSK

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Nurse Vendor
description:
À propos du Neuro et de l’URC

L’unité de recherche clinique fait partie de l’Université McGill et est située au Neuro. Cet établissement, fondé par le Dr Wilder Penfield, comprend l’institut neurologique de Montréal (INM), un institut d’enseignement et de recherche ainsi que l’Hôpital neurologique de Montréal (HNM), qui fait partie du Centre Universitaire de santé McGill (CUSM). Au sein de cet établissement, les scientifiques et les cliniciens ont pour but d’offrir la meilleure qualité de soins neurologiques à la population à travers la recherche fondamentale et la recherche clinique ainsi que par des méthodes chirurgicales innovatrices. Cet emplacement est idéal pour l’URC car il permet d’offrir aux milliers de patients internes et externes du HNM, la possibilité de participer à une étude clinique, s’inscrivant dans le mandat de centre quaternaire du Neuro.

Description de poste

- Assurer un soutien continu aux chercheurs / médecins dans la livraison d'activités et d'informations à jour.

- Lire et comprendre les protocoles d'essais cliniques.

- En collaboration avec les Investigateurs/Médecins, administrer et gérer des perfusions et injections de médicaments, prélever des échantillons de laboratoire (prélever du sang, collecter des échantillons d'urine, etc.), surveiller les symptômes de patients, collecter et enregistrer les données de laboratoire et effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes.

- Assister d’autres professionnels de la santé lors de procédures complexes (ponction lombaire, biopsie musculaire, etc.)

- En collaboration avec le coordonnateur de l’étude et d’autres membres du personnel médical, interpréter l’information reçue sur les patients et user de son jugement clinique lorsqu’indiqué.

- S’assure que les activités sont effectuées conformément au protocole d'essai clinique et aux politiques et procédures de l'Université et du promoteur.

- Communiquer des informations aux médecins, coordinateurs de recherche, patients et infirmier/infirmière de recherche sur les nouvelles informations concernant les patients, les modifications des schémas thérapeutiques, les délais en termes de tests à réaliser (tomodensitométrie, analyses sanguines, etc.), les informations réglementaires, etc.

- Enseigner aux patients comment s'auto‐administrer les médicaments selon le protocole d'essai clinique.

- S’assure du maintien de ses connaissances et de la mise à jour des certifications nécessaires telles que le permis de l’OIIQ, l’harmonisation des pratiques IV, GCP, SOP, Santé Canada Division 5 et de formations continues appropriées.

Horaire

Les heures de travail régulière sont du Lundi au Vendredi entre 7:30 et 18:00 avec des quarts de travail occasionnel de soir et de nuit afin d’accommoder de plus longue visite de patient.

Expérience et éducation

Qualifications minimales requises: Infirmier(ère) inscrit(e) à l’OIIQ, avec préférablement 2 ans ou plus d'expérience clinique en soins infirmiers.
L’expérience en recherche clinique ou neuroscience serait un atout.

Rémunération

- 40$/h quart de travail sur horaire régulier de jour

- 45$/h quart de travail de nuit (maximum de 8h)

Aucun avantage social ou programme d’assurance n’est fourni. Les personnes qui seront embauchées seront considérées comme travailleur autonome.

Comment appliquer

Les lettres de candidature doivent être accompagnées d'un curriculum vitae

Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt, cependant, seuls les candidats sélectionnés pour une entrevue seront contactés.

About the Neuro and the CRU

The clinical research unit is part of McGill University and is located at the Neuro. This building, founded by Dr. Wilder Penfield, comprises the Montreal Neurological Institute, a teaching and research institute, and the Montreal Neurological Hospital, which is part of the McGill University Health Centre (MUHC). Inside its walls, scientists and clinicians strive to bring high quality neurological care to the population through basic and clinical research including new surgical methods. This is the ideal location for the CRU since it can offer participation in clinical trials to the thousands of inpatients and outpatients that pass through the MNH every year, fulfilling the quaternary care mandate of the Neuro.

Job Description

- Ensure continuous support to Investigators/Physicians in the delivery of up‐to‐date activities and information, confirming priorities and timeframes of clinical trial subjects.

- Read and understand clinical trial protocols.

- In conjunction with physicians, administer and manage medication infusions/injections, collect laboratory samples (draw bloods, collect urine samples, etc.), monitor patient symptoms, collect and record laboratory data and perform all other nursing related tasks.

- Assist other medical professionals for complex procedures (lumbar punctures, muscle biopsy, etc.)

- In conjunction with study coordinator and other medical staff, interpret information received on patients and applies clinical judgement when indicated.

- Ensure that the activities are performed in accordance with clinical trial protocol and University and sponsor policies and procedures.

- Communicate information to the doctors, research coordinators, patients and research nurse on new information pertaining to patients, changes to regimens, deadlines in terms of tests to be performed (i.e., CT scan, blood tests, etc.), regulatory information, etc.

- Teach patients how to self‐administer medication as per clinical trial protocol.

- Maintain proper certifications, including OIIQ license, best IV administration practices, GCP, SOP, Health Canada Division 5 and required continuing education.

Schedule

Main hours of operations are Monday to Friday between 7:30 and 18:00 with occasional evening and/or night shifts to accommodate long patient visits.

Education/Experience

Minimum qualifications: Licensed Nurse with preferably 2 or more of clinical nursing experience.
Experience in clinical research and/or neuroscience nursing an asset.

Runeration

- 40$/h for regular day shifts

- 45$/h for night shifts (maximum of 8h)

No benefit package or collective insurance plan is provided. Selected candidates will be considered self-employed workers.

How to apply

Letters of application should be accompanied by a curriculum vitae

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 8 - 24 per week

Salary: $40.00-$45.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • Nursing: 1 year (required)

Language:

  • English (required)
  • French (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • License from the Quebec Order of Nurses? (required)

title: (CAN) Pharmacy Manager (paid OT)
description:
Position Summary...

The Pharmacy Manager is responsible for all day-to-day activities affecting the people, operations, and merchandise in their division. The Pharmacy Manager must also see that the Pharmacy operates according to Walmart policy, professional standards, and provincial and federal regulations.

What you'll do...

Lead the Pharmacy and OTC teams including participation in the recruitment and interviewing of candidates, train all associates on OBWs/SOPs and Walmart workflow and ensures their execution. Develop, assess, motivate and retain team members. Promote Walmart's brand to team members and customers. Develop a functional and collaborative with the Prof Services District Manager. Develop a functional and collaborative relationship with the Store Management team and the Store Manager.

Must operate Pharmacy to achieve established plans and budgets. Responsible for efficient Associates' scheduling according to business needs, ongoing associate assessment and periodic performance reviews. Responsible for developing and executing business action plans to meet the corporate goals and developing corrective action plans based on deficiencies identified in reports (P&L, FSA visits, POAs, etc.) or by audits and DM visits. Responsible for maintaining accurate inventories in the Pharmacy by following Walmart OBWs/SOPs (receiving inventory management, disposal of expired products), addressing all customer complaints and resolve all customer problems to ensure excellent customer experience. Responsible for the regular care of the Pharmacy to ensure a proper appearance and hospital clean environment for associates and patients. Must maintain the professional image for the Pharmacy area as per Workstation Standardization and 6S Audit. Responsible for cascading communication coming from the SSC to all Pharmacy associates and OTC.

Execute all programs assigned to the Pharmacy by the Prof Services team.

Develop and establish collaborative relationships with other health care providers within the store (clinics, Vision Centre, their community etc.). Ensure that Pharmacy is open and operational during the posted business hours. Supervise and support the OTC manager in their everyday duties and responsibilities. Ensure excellent patient experience, locate merchandise on the sales floor.

Establish and develop a strong working relationship with Professional Services District Managers and other stakeholders.

Accept prescriptions and/or refill requests from Customers, Doctors or Hospitals.

Ensure all prescriptions are filled accurately, efficiently, and safely using the established workflow models and counsel all patients on sold pharmaceutical products.

Ensure proper storage of pharmaceutical products.

Execute processes as per OBWs/SOPs.

Ability to operate all equipment in the pharmacy (register, computer system etc.) Protect and maintain patient privacy at all times and follow provincial regulations established by the regulatory body. Ensure patients receive all eligible services they are entitled to (medication reviews, injections etc.) to meet specific patient needs. Ensure that Pharmacy is open and operational during the posted business hours.

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Age - 16 or older License - Pharmacist License (secondary optional permit in Alberta: CA_APA - Additional Prescribing Authorization)

Preferred Qualifications...

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Walmart will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants and associates as required by law.

Primary Location…

2210 BANK ST, OTTAWA, ON K1V 1J5, Canada

title: Chef Amélioration Continue
description:
Site Name: Canada - Quebec - Quebec
Posted Date: Dec 2 2021


* Seuls les candidats vivant actuellement au Canada, avec le droit légal de travailler ici, seront considérés *

* Only applicants currently living in Canada, with the legal right to work here, will be considered *

Le chef amélioration continue est responsable de la gestion et coordination de l’équipe des champions en amélioration continue et des initiatives transversales du site. L’objectif est d’assurer l’amélioration continue de la performance site et le développement des capacités des équipes.

The Continuous Improvement Manager is responsible for managing and coordinating the team of Continuous Improvement Champions and cross-functional site initiatives. The objective is to ensure the continuous improvement of site performance and the development of team capacities.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Il est responsable du déploiement et du maintien de l’amélioration continue sur le site Ste-Foy

  • Il est responsable de la compréhension et du déploiement des outils d’amélioration continue sur le site

  • Il est responsable de détecter, comprendre, adapter et déployer sur le site, les nouveaux outils/méthodologies en amélioration continue provenant de réseau GSK mais de manière plus générale en dehors de GSK aussi.

  • Il identifie, mesure, propose et réalise des initiatives transversales influençant positivement la stratégie du site

  • Via son réseau GSK et sa maitrise des processus, il est capable de supporter le site par des études comparatives et partage de bonnes pratiques d’excellence opérationnelle, Lean et gestion de la performance

  • Il exerce le rôle d’expert lors de revue de processus ou de problématique site pour assurer l’efficacité du groupe dans l’atteinte de ses objectifs

  • Il agit comme point de contact principal pour les équipes globales mais aussi pour les autres sites du réseau GSK.

  • QUALITÉ

    • Connaître, faire appliquer et appliquer de façon rigoureuse les procédures en lien avec son secteur

    • S’assurer de la mise à jour des procédures du secteur

    • S’assurer de l’indentification de la documentation de l’escalation adéquate des problèmes qualité en lien avec son secteur

    • Participer et être en support des investigations en cas de déviations et de CAPA

    • Participer aux audits et aux inspections en lien avec son secteur

  • SANTÉ ET SÉCURITÉ

    • Respecter les procédures de santé, sécurité et environnement

    • Respecter les obligations règlementaires en matière de santé, sécurité et environnement

    • Participer aux analyses de risques de sa fonction

    • Respecter les règles de sécurité, notamment les EPI

    • Déclarer les situations à risques

    • Identifier les facteurs d’amélioration

QUALIFICATIONS DE BASE

  • Baccalauréat en sciences ou ingénierie ou expérience équivalente

  • Au mois 3 ans d’expérience dans un environnement pharmaceutique

  • Minimum de 2 ans d’expérience en gestion d’équipe

  • Niveau intermédiaire en anglais

  • Expérience et compréhension du système de formation GMP

  • Expertise et compréhension des principes de la méthodologie Lean Six Sigma

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor of Science or Engineering or equivalent experience

  • At least 3 years of experience in a pharmaceutical environment

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in team management

  • Intermediate level in English and fluent in French

  • Experience and understanding of the GMP training system

  • Expertise and understanding of the principles of Lean Six Sigma methodology

-

QUALIFICATIONS PRÉFÉRÉES

  • Qualité de gestion et leadership avérés

  • Certification green ou black belt

  • ADP practicioner

  • Expérience en RCA (root cause analysis) ou champion RCA

  • Compréhension du procédé de fabrication du vaccin

  • Compétences en matière de communication verbale et écrite à tous les niveaux de l’organisation

    • Habilite de communiquer de idées et concepts de manière clair et convaincante

  • Habilité de créer une culture d’ouverture, transparence et objectivité de manière à assurer que les problématiques et risques sont bien gérés.

    • Développe cette capacite dans son équipe

  • Sens de l’urgence flexibilité et responsabilités

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Proven management quality and leadership

  • Green or black belt certification

  • ADP practitioner

  • Experience in RCA (root cause analysis) or RCA champion

  • Understanding of the vaccine manufacturing process

  • Oral and written communication skills at all levels of the organization

    • Ability to communicate ideas and concepts in a clear and convincing manner

  • Ability to create a culture of openness, transparency and objectivity so as to ensure that issues and risks are well managed.

    • Develop this ability in your team

  • Sense of urgency, flexibility and responsibilities

  • LI-GSK

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: newSales representative in Mental Health -R304
description:
We are currently looking for a qualified Sales Representative specialized in mental health for the Territory R304, Calgary and South Alberta . This is a permanent full-time job, reporting to the Regional Business Manager, Mood Disorders. Lundbeck Canada offers comprehensive benefits to its employees, including health and dental benefits and contribution to a pension plan as of day 1.
The Mental Health Specialist is part of a regional team that is highly effective, motivated, innovative and enthusiastic to achieve sales objectives for Lundbeck Canada. The Mental Health Specialist reports to a Regional Business Manager, Mood Disorders.

The safety of our patients: You are expected to immediately forward any reports of adverse events or special situations on our products as well as any product complaints and counterfeit or suspected counterfeit medicine to Medical Information and Pharmacovigilance (canadamedicalinformation@lundbeck.com) as per training on current procedures.

Achievement of Sales objectives (50%)
  • Achieve territory sales objectives for Lundbeck promoted products in Psychiatry.
  • Implement territory plan of action, including field call activities as established by the sales and marketing teams for each defined cycle.
  • Fully understand and promote Lundbeck psychiatry and partnered products and services to hospitals, clinics, and healthcare providers, using sales cycle promotional material in an efficient, professional and compliant manner.
  • Build and maintain relations with clients (doctors, nurses, and business partners); identify their needs; inform them about Lundbeck’s high-quality products.
  • Stay abreast of competing products and scientific developments for psychiatry products.

Business Planning (25%)
  • In accordance with the sales function plan and the Regional Business Manager, develop and revisit regularly a territory business plan and implement key tactics to maximize selling efforts, optimize growth opportunities and achieve sales.
  • Leverage different communication channels to have most efficient access to HCP (face to face and virtual).
  • Manage field budget adequately to optimize reach and targeted customer interaction.
  • Execute tailored call preparation and call review process in alignment with the Lundbeck selling model in order to move customers along the adoption ladder.
  • Use the sales and performance report system (KPIs) to optimize performance across the territory.
  • Continuously gather insights in territory through interactions with customers and adapt tactics accordingly.
  • Collaborate with sales team members and other departments -including marketing, training, business effectiveness and medical teams- to offer tailored solutions and maximize psychiatry product(s) potential and sales; be an active contributor to help improve and optimize national and regional business activities.
  • Attend company meetings and main industry conventions

Medical Communication and Education Activities (20%)
  • Effectively implement needs-based, certified programs (CHEs) and other learning activities (OLAs) as per cycle plan of action and follow-up to optimize impact.
  • Work closely with the Medical Science Liaison and Medical Education teams to identify educational opportunities and develop advocacy in territory.
  • Ensure compliance and respect for ethical rules in all learning activities implemented with customers.

Administration and Corporate Compliance (5%)
  • Update and maintain the key customer target list.
  • Use the CRM (Customer Relations Management System) to ensure that field activities are captured and documented.
  • Use of the company’s expense reporting system in a timely manner.
  • Comply with Lundbeck Canada processes and satisfy business needs in a cost efficient and timely manner.
  • Always stay updated on and abide by Lundbeck Canada's legal and compliance procedures.

Position Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree in life sciences or business administration
  • A minimum of 2 year of sales experience, ideally in the Canadian pharmaceutical industry
  • Experience in the CNS field and/or working with psychiatrists an asset
  • Strong business acumen and analytical skills
  • Bilingualism in English and French an asset (required for Quebec's position)
  • Familiar with the use of technology (ie: iPad, apps, etc.) including proficiency with Microsoft products (Word, Excel, etc.); experience with the use of technologies to access HCP an asset

Working conditions
  • Regular Office hours: Yes
  • Evening/Weekend commitments: No
  • % of travel required: 10-40%

title: newBooking Clerk
description:
Job Description:
Job Title:
Booking Clerk

Work Site:

Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI), Richmond Hospital - Richmond, BC

Status:
Temporary Part Time (0.73 FTE)

Start Date:
As soon as possible until approximately June 2023

Salary:
$23.40 per hour

Hours:

1500-2300, 1530-2330 or as operationally required
Days off: 4 on / 4 off rotation

Reference#:
162372-jim

Come work as a Booking Clerk with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Booking Clerk to join the Magnetic Resonance Imaging team at Richmond Hospital in Richmond, BC. Apply today to join our team!

As a Booking Clerk you will:
  • Perform scheduling and booking functions for a variety of patient appointments for designated areas within Radiology.
  • Support the Medical Imaging team by performing duties such as:
    • arranging times with patients, doctor's offices, nursing units, physicians, technical staff and surgical/medical daycare
    • making follow up appointments
    • locating applicable images/films prior to appointments
    • rearranging schedules to meet changing demands/requests
    • preparing and confirming patient information
    • entering booking, patient and image/film information into radiology and hospital computerized and/or manual booking and patient information systems
    • filing requisitions for all bookings
    • acting as receptionist to support the delivery of patient care
    • ensure client/family needs are met above all other concerns
QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience
  • Grade 12, two years' recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Knowledge & Abilities
  • Ability to keyboard at 40 wpm.
  • Knowledge of medical terminology.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff
Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

VCH is proud to be recognized as a Best Place to Work in Canada in 2021 by Glassdoor and Forbes.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.



***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.
