title: Clinical Pharmacist
description:
Qualifications:

  • Bachelors Degree in Pharmacy
  • Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) preferred
  • Registered as a Part A Pharmacist with the Ontario College of Pharmacists
  • Designation certification is an asset, such as geriatric pharmacist, anticoagulation pharmacist, antibiotic stewardship, diabetic educator, etc.
  • 2 years’ work experience in a healthcare setting
  • Excellent computer skills
  • Hospital pharmacy residency certificate preferred
  • Evidence of good performance history and attendance record
  • Ability to work in a manner that exemplifies the centre’s core values and helps patients get their life back
  • Should be aware of conditions and measures that may affect the safety of patients, residents, students, employees, volunteers, physicians and visitors

Accountabilities:

  • Participate in patient care rounds and provide pharmaceutical care, including medication reconciliation upon admission and discharge, therapeutic drug monitoring etc.
  • Develop clinical expertise pertaining to specific patient populations.
  • Provide drug information to physicians, nurses, and other clinicians to enhance patient care.
  • Verification of all medication orders for inpatients.
  • Act as a preceptor for Pharmacy students.
  • Provide education to patients to promote optimal drug use.
  • Organize and participate in quarterly medication reviews on specific units.
  • Start, teach and monitor patients in the self-medication program.
  • Participate on hospital committees as required.
  • Provision of Saturday coverage and on-call responsibility in rotation with other West Park pharmacists.

Please Note: All West Park Healthcare Centre employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire in accordance with the hospital’s COVID-19 Immunization Policy. Accommodations to this requirement under the Ontario Human Rights Code may be available subject to supporting evidence.


At West Park Healthcare Centre, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment, an important part of living our brand. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community. Our accessible employment practices are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Should you require accommodation during any phase of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter. For further assistance please contact the Human Resources Department at (416) 243-3600 extension 4637.

title: Medical Secretary Clinical Programs, BC Cancer Agency, Surre...
description:
Medical Secretary Clinical Programs
BC Cancer Agency
Surrey, BC

As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.

Are you a highly organized person with strong administrative skills?
The Secretary provides secretarial and administrative support within a team setting.

What you’ll do
  • Arrange meeting times, book meeting rooms, notify attendees, and circulate relevant materials as requested. Act as a recording secretary by preparing agenda; drafting, typing and distributing minutes of the various meetings. Initiate and take follow-up action as indicated in the minutes.
  • Screen and prioritize incoming requests for the attention of medical team staff by: Determining urgency of incoming calls regarding patients and taking appropriate action. Relaying patient information to and from doctors' offices and outside hospitals. Obtaining reports by contacting appropriate Agency departments or outside sources, on an emergency basis if necessary. Ensuring timely follow up action is taken by medical staff in response to calls. Coordinating appointments and tests for patients as requested by medical team. Accessing patient information system to retrieve patient data. Coordinating clinic and other appointments for medical staff. Initiating responses where appropriate.
  • Coordinate and prepare for clinic conferences, including: Sending out notices, typing case notes/histories, co-ordinating patient activity with ACU staff, and photocopying.
  • Prepare on-call lists and weekly staff schedule.
  • Use word processing software type, format and edit documents such as correspondence and memos from transcribing equipment, hand-written or electronic drafts. Draft routine items for signature as required.
  • Use word processing software type, prepare presentation materials such as abstracts, posters, papers, handouts and slides for educational sessions, workshops and conferences, as directed.
  • Screen and prioritize calls from all sources including patients; refer calls to other parties or provide information as appropriate. Greet visitors and handle enquiries.
  • Maintain a schedule of appointments for medical staff and visitors.
  • Open, screen, prioritize and distribute incoming mail. Maintain files of incoming and outgoing information and correspondence.
  • Assist in research by typing research proposals and grant applications and by gathering information and articles from various sources such as the library.
  • Maintain familiarity and complie with PHSA and BCCA directives and work standards; provide information to clinic physician as required.
  • Assist with collection, collation and reporting of workload and quality assurance statistics.
  • Participate in interdepartmental meetings for patient flow or workload related meetings.
  • Perform timekeeping for relevant physicians and staff regarding illnesses and absence from work, and communicate information to relevant departments.
  • Provide administrative support for professional travel: including booking travel arrangements and submitting expenses for approval.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.


What you bring
  • Grade 12, graduation from a recognized secretarial program, including a recognized course in medical transcription and three years recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Ability to keyboard at 60 wpm.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position

What’s in it for you

Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
  • Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
  • Access to more than 2,000 in-house training programs.
  • Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan.
  • 12 annual statutory holidays with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
  • Perks include onsite fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.

Job type: Temporary, Full-Time Contract ending 11/11/2022
Wage: $26.65 per hour
Location: Surrey
Hours of work: 0800-1600/0830-1630 or as operationally required.
Reference number: #121755

What we do

BC Cancer bccancer.bc.ca provides comprehensive cancer control for the people of British Columbia. BC Cancer program is part of the Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA).

(PHSA) plans, coordinates and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose.

Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services

PHSA is committed to employment equity and hires on the basis of merit, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, backgrounds and experiences, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

title: Senior Clinical Research Associate
description:
Description

Summary
The candidate would join the clinical research team supporting NERv Technology Inc.’s clinical studies. They will participate in the activation process for future clinical trials which will include study and protocol design, site selection, site activation, clinical site monitoring, study closeout, reporting of clinical data and overall management of other clinical operations. The candidate will engage in medical writing, management of clinical activities at sites, and working with Principal Investigator’s and the research teams to ensure the smooth operation of NERv's clinical trial.
This position will require travel between clinical research sites.
Who We Are
NERv aims to create a paradigm shift in post-operative care, utilizing the plethora of data within the body, to help in the detection of post-operative complications at their onset. NERv’s platform sensing technology augments existing wound drains and catheters, providing healthcare providers with a smart monitoring tool that can enhance the delivery of care. NERv’s technology is being built with the goal of decreasing surgeon’s response time to potential complications, making patient recovery easier, and hopefully saving lives.
Responsibilities
  • Developing protocol designs and trial implementation strategies that are efficient, cost effective and customized to the unique clinical and trial environment of various centers
  • Building and maintaining an EDC (Electronic Data Capture) system through the design of comprehensive electronic case report forms (CRFs).
  • Prepare Independent Ethics Committee/Independent Regulatory Board (IEC/REB) submissions
  • Prepare final reports and manuscripts for publication
  • Manage regulatory authority applications and approvals that oversee the research as necessary
  • Generate and negotiate clinical trial agreements (CRAs) with finance and legal departments at numerous sites.
  • Assess site qualification by reviewing study requirements, designing feasibility surveys, conducting pre-study visits, and generating pre-study evaluation reports.
  • Identify Principal Investigators and Co-investigators who will be responsible for conducting the trial at individual trial sites
  • Set-up trial sites for study activation
  • Organizing training sessions for nursing staff, participating surgeons, and other perioperative healthcare providers to ensure proper compliance to all study activities.
  • Monitoring the study to ensure that it is ethically conducted, follows regulatory standards, is compliant with GCP, protocol, local, and federal laws/regulations.
  • Attending meetings, events, and other activities within the hospital to promote the study and improve enrollment.
  • Define strategies to improve subject enrollment rates and improve study compliance, as necessary.
  • Ensure that all eCRFs are completed by research personnel at the respective sites
  • Verify that data entered on eCRFs is consistent with source data/documents (SDV) and raise queries as necessary
  • Conduct site visits and complete visit reports
  • Acting as a point of reference for research staff and PI by answering questions and keeping them informed on the study progress through newsletters or frequent meetings.
  • Managing the inventory of equipment and supplies related to the study and ordering/shipping more as needed.
  • Interpret study data and conduct statistical analysis testing on collected data
  • Generate Interim Analysis reports to outline study progress as dictated by the protocol
  • Prepare reports for protocol amendments as necessary
  • Perform study closeout upon completion of the trial
  • Generate technical trial reports to outline study results and present finding to doctors, consultants or investigators involved in the conduct of the study.
  • Create reports including notes on protocols, workload, data collection, and more.
  • Present study findings through posters, presentations, etc. at conferences or clinical research meetings.
Skills/Qualifications
You are detail-oriented, organized and are able to work independently in a fast-paced environment. You are not afraid to take the driver's seat, love to learn and can quickly grasp new concepts as they arise during your work. If this sounds like you, we would love to meet you!
  • 2+ years previous experience with clinical studies.
  • Degree in Science or in progress: background in anatomy, biochemistry, biology, biomedical science is preferred. Master’s or PhD at least.
  • Excellent communication, both written and verbal, and interpersonal skills
  • The ability to build effective relationships with trial centre staff and colleagues
  • The ability to motivate others
  • Project management skills
  • Experience with statistical testing and data science knowledge is an asset.
  • Experience with EDC (Castor/RedCap) is an asset.
  • Experience with medical writing.
  • Meticulous and detail oriented.
  • Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to learn new software tools.
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task.
  • Familiarity with health research and database management preferred.
  • Good Clinical Practices (GCP) Certification required.

Compensation

$60,000.00 - $65,000.00

title: Medical Secretary
description:
Medical Secretary
Oncology Clinic
Victoria, BC

Are you a highly organized person with strong secretarial and administrative skills?

The Medical Secretary provides a variety of senior secretarial, administrative and other support duties for appropriate Medical Staff to ensure the effective operation of Medical Staff office.

What you’ll do
  • Perform secretarial and administrative duties for appropriate Medical Staff.
  • Receive screens and prioritizes incoming calls from doctors’ offices and patients, takes messages, relays information including patient data to and from doctors’ offices and referring hospitals.
  • Arrange appropriate action for urgent follow-up appointments, simulator or therapy bookings as indicated by specific physicians and in conjunction with appropriate staff such as Nursing, Radiotherapy Planning or Radiotherapy Treatment.
  • Ensure that requests for relevant supporting investigations from referring hospitals and physicians are forwarded to appropriate Clinic departments for immediate action. Conducts follow-up as required.
  • Prepare physician itineraries on a regular basis and establishes a system whereby physicians can be contacted on urgent matters.
  • Liaise with British Columbia Cancer Agency Library Staff and others as required.
  • Access patient information system to retrieve confidential patient data.
  • Ensure that timely follow-up action is taken by Medical Staff in response to telephone messages.
  • Participate in drafting of departmental directives and procedures; liaises with administration regarding modification to and creation of Clinic directives and procedures.
  • Maintain familiarity with Clinic and British Columbia Cancer Agency directives and procedures, particularly those related to patient care; provides information to clinic physician as required.
  • Liaise with other Clinic departments and participates in resolving communication and other workflow issues and concerns.
  • Assist with gathering of reports relating to workload measurement and Quality Assurance.
  • Type urgent annotations in Clinic charts as directed by physician according to Clinic and Agency Health Records policies and procedures.
  • Ensure that requests by Medical Staff for urgently needed reports are acted upon by appropriate Clinic departments.
  • Maintain related filing and record keeping systems.
  • Transcribe reports and papers for publication from handwritten or dictated material utilizing personal computer.
  • Assist physicians in independent clinical research projects using resources within British Columbia Cancer Agency Clinics’ Health Records Departments.
  • Arrange registration for meetings and conferences, books hotel accommodations and makes travel arrangements consistent with Agency policy.
  • Perform other related duties as required.

What you bring
  • Grade 12, graduation from a recognized secretarial program, including a recognized course in medical transcription and three years recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Ability to type 60 words per minute.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
  • Ability to deal with others effectively
  • Ability to organize work
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position
  • Ability to operate related equipment


What’s in it for you
Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
  • Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
  • Access to more than 2,000 in-house training programs.
  • Perks include onsite fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.

Job type Casual (0.01FTE)
Location Victoria
Department Systemic Therapy/ Radiation Therapy
Rate $26.65/hour
Start date December 6, 2021
Reference number 116411

Please note that being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 beginning on October 26, 2021 will now be a condition of employment with PHSA.

What we do
PHSA plans, coordinates and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to program is part of the Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA).

Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services
PHSA is committed to employment equity and hires on the basis of merit, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, backgrounds and experiences, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

title: newFamily Physician - L'Ardoise
description:
Requisition ID: 55302

Opportunity Type: Permanent

Estimated Annual Salary: 250,000 - 300,000

Type of Remuneration: APP- Alternative Payment Plan

Site Visit & Reallocation Allowance Programs: Relocation Program; Site Visit Program

Department of Health & Wellness Incentives: Debt Assistance; Family Medicine Bursary Program; Tuition Relief


About This Opportunity

Dr. Kingston Community Health Centre, located in L'Ardoise, is seeking a full-time family physician to join their local family practice team. The team works collaboratively together and includes 1 full-time family practice nurse, 1 full-time nurse practitioner, a visiting dietician, and a visiting social worker. This opportunity requires participation in nursing home coverage and inpatient care (participating in the CHIP program). Also, opportunity exists to participate in a variety of other areas that fit your professional interests and skill set including, but not limited to, emergency room coverage, addictions medicine, etc. Physicians are supported to engage in research and/or teaching positions with Dalhousie University. This clinic utilizes MedAccess as the EMR, and administrative support staff is available to physicians.

The Dr. Kingston Community Health Centre is approximately 30 minutes from the areas' local hospital, Strait Richmond Hospital (SRH). SRH serves residents of Richmond County and the southern portion of Inverness County. The two regional referral centres for the area include Cape Breton Regional Hospital (located in Sydney) and St. Martha's Regional Hospital (located in Antigonish). Both regional hospitals are located approximately 1 hour and 20 minutes away from L'Ardoise.

Responsibilities

  • duties include full scope of practice as a family physician providing care to patients within the eastern zone and participating in call
  • the physician will be responsible to the Zone Department Head of Family Practice for their professional responsibilities and quality of practice, and will operate within the Medical Staff Bylaws of the Nova Scotia Health Authority

Expected Hours

  • full-time

Qualifications

  • eligible for licensure with the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Nova Scotia (CPSNS)
  • eligible for certification with the College of Family Physicians of Canada (CFPC)
  • membership with the Canadian Medical Protective Association (CMPA)

Community Details

The community of L'Ardoise is located in Richmond County, on the southern coast of scenic Cape Breton Island. L'Ardoise is a small fishing village that has a history of French and Acadian culture. Affordable housing, ocean views, easy access to beaches, hiking trails, and an array of outdoor activities make L'Ardoise a great place to have a rewarding career and lifestyle! To learn more about what it's like to work as a physician here, visit:

Dr. Kingston Community Health Centre

Cape Breton Doctors

Richmond County

Physicians in Nova Scotia provide fulfilling patient care which embraces family life, professional development and community involvement. That's what makes practicing medicine in Nova Scotia unique. Physicians are increasingly attracted to practices that offer team-based care to their patients and allow them to consult with their peers. The size and scale of Nova Scotia allows for better connections across the health care system. Your practice of medicine and your life is richer here. Nova Scotia is more than medicine.


Nova Scotia Health Authority (NSHA) is committed to being a workforce that is free of discrimination, values diversity and is representative, at all job levels, of the people we serve. Our priority groups are Aboriginal People, African Nova Scotians, Persons with Disabilities and Recent Immigrants. Members of these groups are welcome to apply and self-identify if they wish to be considered under our Employment Equity policy.

title: Demand Planning Manager, Consumer Healthcare
description:
Site Name: Canada - Ontario - Mississauga
Posted Date: Apr 18 2022


* Please note - this role to commence as a 12 month contract opportunity *

Why Consumer Healthcare?


Right now, we’re on an incredible journey as we prepare to become the first independent, 100% focused consumer healthcare company. We’re doing this at a time when the work we do has never mattered more. Better everyday health is about improving the health and wellness of the consumers that we touch every year – over a billion and a half of them – and it goes beyond products. It’s about truly helping people manage their health proactively in different ways as consumer needs evolve.


With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.


This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion


In Consumer Healthcare we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.


We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide detailed, timely forecast reporting across all categories for input to Consensus Forecast Review and Demand Review Meeting
  • Develop exception reporting to enable identification and management of forecast accuracy impacts and month to month forecast changes.
  • Lead and own process changes and analytical reviews to continuously improve SKU level Forecast Accuracy and Bias.
  • To maintain ongoing and up-to-date SKU forecast in SAP/APO within required lead times.
  • Collaboration with Product Supply on forecast changes and/or updates to SAP/APO
  • Embed processes to support key account forecast capability to drive enhanced service levels and reduced working capital requirements
  • To incorporate all pertinent internal and external information identified through analysis and collaboration with Marketing, Sales, and Product Supply in order to achieve consistent and unbiased Forecast Accuracy results.
  • Contribute to significant projects to transform the operating model, and deliver the benefits required including gross to net, complexity reduction, cost of goods and working capital reductions etc
  • Provide support for baseline statistical modeling to deliver enhanced forecast accuracy
  • To provide forecast information to various sources for capacity planning, procurement, and to support annual financial planning process
  • To work with Product Supply and Promotional Manager/Sales to ensure all Display items are accurately reflected in the forecast.
  • Other duties as required (i.e. root cause analysis, new product forecast models, allocation management)

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Degree preferably in a Supply chain related discipline (logistics, supply management, demand management, operational management)
  • In depth knowledge of Demand planning, preferably from an FMCG environment, with more than 5 years related experience, knowledge of scheduling, supply planning considered an asset
  • Experience with Statistical Modelling tools
  • Experience with Forecasting Seasonal businesses considered an asset
  • Knowledge of database managing and reporting tools, e.g. Power BI, MS Access
  • Advanced level Excel skills required.
  • Highly numerate with knowledge of supply chain forecasting / trade spend software systems and processes preferred.
  • Proficient in the use of SAP APO & BI
  • Exposure to Sales and Operations Planning processes ideally in an FMCG environment
  • Strong planning ability & able to work on own initiative.
  • High attention to detail.
  • Project Management skills
  • Strong analytical and interpersonal skills.
  • Proactively seeks opportunities to increase value by raising standards & championing best practices

  • LI-GSK

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: PART TIME or FULL TIME ASSOCIATE
description:
search of a full-time or part-time associate to join our practice in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. We are a locally owned and operated (non-consolidated) small animal practice who has been serving the community for over 35 years. We have grown from a single veterinarian practice to a staff over 35 and two locations. The Greenbank Animal Hospital maintains a busy steady-paced environment while the Village of Manotick Animal Hospital has a small-town atmosphere with a smaller team on-site. Our staff have the option to work at both/either clinic(s) as they are located only a 10-minute drive from one another, so you have the opportunity to experience the best of both worlds.

We proudly continue to offer personalized gold standard care to our patients and outstanding service to their pet parents.

Covid-19 has put many things in perspective and reinforced our core workplace principles which above all else, is to provide a safe environment for staff, patients, and clients in addition to supporting our team members.

You can expect the full support of our team which consists of 6 full-time veterinarians including 3 practicing Partners. There are multiple veterinarians on-site daily to provide mentorship where needed and assist with navigating medical issues and surgical procedures. We have a strong team-oriented approach to patient care. Our experienced roster of RVT’s and VA’s are committed to following well established surgical protocols and assisting our doctors with appointments, x-ray’s, and labwork. Our front desk staff are skilled at ensuring client satisfaction, troubleshooting issues, and booking balanced appointment schedules. We also have an on-site practice manager to assist the support staff and allow you to focus on practicing medicine. New grads welcome!

Other reasons to join our team:

  • Locally owned and operated
  • No evening or weekend work
  • No after-hours emergency work
  • Established clientele which continues to grow across both locations
  • Opportunity to develop your own client following
  • Strong team-based approach to patient care as well as work schedules
  • An environment in which the associates’ opinions and suggestions matter
  • No revenue generation requirements or quotas to meet
  • Competitive salary with paid vacation or commission-based pay options
  • Signing Bonus negotiable
  • CE allowance/dental wet-lab training
  • VIN, CVO, and license fees covered
  • DR digital radiology, digital dental, inhouse lab, ultrasound on site
  • Access to 3 emergency hospitals and mobile specialty service for referrals
  • Advancement opportunities in ownership of a non-consolidated, independently owned practice available for qualified candidates

What we’re looking for:

  • Passion for providing a high standard of care
  • Team-centered mindset
  • Hands on approach and a willingness to continuously learn
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

Please contact our Practice Manager, Kelly Leroux at Kelly.leroux@rogers.com if you are interested. For more information about our clinics please visit greenbankanimalhosp.com and villageofmanotickanimalhospital.com.

title: Reception / Tech Assistant
description:
Rocky Ridge Pet Hospital is currently looking for a Receptionist/ Veterinary Assistant to join our dynamic team of veterinary professionals! By joining the Rocky Ridge team, you are joining a team that puts the utmost value on our staff and because of this, you will have the opportunity to grow and use your skills in the veterinary field to the highest potential.

Job Responsibilities

· Working alongside our veterinarians and technicians to care for patients

· Maintaining the cleanliness of the hospital

· Communication with clients

· Invoicing clients, answering phones, booking appointments

· Feeding, cleaning and walking hospitalized patients

· Sterilizing and preparing surgical equipment

· Administrative duties

· Other duties, as required

Job Requirements:

As our ideal candidate, you will:

· Be comfortable handling animals

· Have knowledge of and the ability to learn basic veterinary terminology

· Have excellent communication skills

· Have prior experience with or the ability to learn Avimark software

· Be comfortable working under pressure, while keeping calm

· Be proactive and take initiatives to work effectively without supervision

· Be a team player

· Be able to prioritize your workload

Why join the Rocky Ridge Team?

Rocky Ridge Pet Hospital is a fast paced three doctor practice located in the North West region of Rocky Ridge in Calgary. By joining the Rocky Ridge team, you will be offered competitive wages, health benefits, staff discounts, and most importantly a positive, exciting, and fun place to grow in the veterinary field!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.00-$17.00 per hour

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.00-$17.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Veterinary Reception: 1 year (preferred)
  • Veterinarian Tech Assistant: 1 year (preferred)
  • Customer Service: 1 year (preferred)

title: Veterinary Receptionist/Administration
description:
Job Summary

Cedarbrae Veterinary Clinic is seeking a cheerful and motivated animal-lover for a full time, permanent Client Care Representative position. We are a 3 doctor, CVO accredited companion animal hospital that focuses on dogs, cats, bunnies, and small mammals. The ideal candidate will be dedicated to bettering the lives of clients and patients alike.

Responsibilities and Duties

-Answering calls, booking appointments, submitting insurance claims, following up on patients and contacting clients for reminders, able to correspond with clients in person, by phone and email.

-Serve as a liaison between doctors, and clients.

-Data entry, transcribing and maintaining electronic patient files in accordance with CVO regulations.

-Handling payments, balancing end of day and closing interac machine.

-Submitting vet purchasing orders and daily inventory

Qualifications and Skills

-Excellent communication, organizational, and customer service skills.

-Positive attitude, friendly, and a problem solver.

-Able to multi-task and strong attention to detail.

-Able to work well in a team setting.

-Knowledge of general office equipment and Microsoft Office

-Flexible schedule, as weekend/late shifts will be required

-Previous Veterinary Clinic and Avimark experience an asset

Benefits

We offer competitive wages (commensurate on experience), health and dental benefits, uniform allowances, continue education fund and amazing veterinary discounts for your pets for all full-time staff.

Job Type: Full-time

Experience:

  • Veterinary Receptionist: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Customer Service: 1 year (Required)
  • Avimark experience (Preferred)

Education:

  • Secondary School (Required)

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Dental care

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $14.00-$20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Veterinary Assistant: 1 year (preferred)
  • Veterinary Receptionist: 1 year (preferred)
  • Customer Service: 1 year (preferred)

title: newReceptionist
description:
MCI The Doctor's Office is one of Canada's largest primary medical care groups, with 25 clinics conveniently located across Ontario and Alberta.


MCI The Doctor's Office allows more than one million patients to access a vast, multidisciplinary group of medical doctors, specialists, healthcare practitioners and therapists, and related services.


A career with MCI The Doctor's Office is more than using your talent and experience to earn a living; it's about choosing a workplace where you can truly make a difference. Enjoy the autonomy of leading a clinic supported by a management group that is one of the best in the business.


MCI The Doctor's Office currently has an opportunity for 1 Part-Time Receptionist at our Mount Pleasant location, located at 245 Eglinton Ave. E Toronto, ON M4P 3B7.


Job Summary

Reporting to the Clinic Manager, the Receptionist is the first point of contact for all patients, staff, and the public. With excellent communication skills and impeccable attention to detail, the Receptionist provides support to patients, physicians, and the clinic team in a caring manner while maintaining confidentiality.


Reporting to the Clinic Manager, the Receptionist duties will include:

  • Manage the front desk/reception operations, acting as the first point of contact for patients, physicians, and clinical care team,
  • Perform general administrative tasks, including answering and directing phone calls, email correspondence, faxing, filing, meeting minutes, mailings, and deliveries.
  • Oversee and order office supplies, anticipate requirements, stock supply stations.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Medical administration diploma from a post-secondary institution is an asset.
  • Must have 1 – 2 years’ experience in an administrative assistant within a healthcare environment.
  • Accuro EMR experience is an asset and use of technology efficient.
  • Proven administrative experience.
  • Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong time-management skills and multitasking ability.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, with an aptitude to learn new software and systems.
  • Clinical Setting Background/Non-Hospital experience an asset.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a collaborative model.

MCI is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a barrier-free environment. Please advise via email if you require accommodation during any part of the recruitment process.

title: Hospitalist - Yarmouth
description:
Requisition ID: 98034

Opportunity Type: Permanent

Estimated Annual Salary: 250,000 - 300,000

Type of Remuneration: Daily Rate

Site Visit & Reallocation Allowance Programs: Relocation Program; Site Visit Program


About This Opportunity

Yarmouth Regional Hospital (YRH), in Yarmouth, is seeking full time (2:4 weeks), part time (1:4 weeks) and locum physicians for the Hospitalist program. The program currently consists of four Hospitalist lines covering 15-20 patients of mixed acuity. YRH is a close knit and very collegial site, providing ample support and a rewarding work experience.
Remuneration is $1400.26 per day for the full-time, evening and weekend call stipend, plus fee-for-service billings for anyone seen after 5pm and before 8am.
The setting for our program is the YRH, which is a friendly and collegial workplace where everyone actually does know your name. The hospital houses a 24 hour level III Emergency Department and district trauma centre, 93 inpatient beds, 7 bed ICU, 3 operating suites, and provides a range of primary and secondary services through in-patient, outpatient and satellite programs, skilled nursing staff and Helipad for emergency airlift to Halifax. Inpatient Units includes Surgical, Medical, Obstetrics & Nursery, ICU, and Mental Health.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • be accountable for management of your panel of hospitalist patients
  • provide care and coordination of community-based care, and secondary and tertiary level heath care
  • operate within the Bylaws and Rules and Regulations of Nova Scotia Health Authority
  • participate in quality improvement and evaluation activities

Expected Hours

While on hospitalist for the week you will be on call for your patients 24/7 (usually minimal calls overnight and rarely called in to the hospital in the evening). The position will require coverage for 1 or 2 weeks per 4 week cycle (1:4 or 2:4). If you desire, there is the potential to work additional weeks of hospitalist as availability permits, and there may be additional work opportunities in the orphan patient clinic, ER shifts, or locuming in local family doctor offices during your weeks off from hospitalist duties.

Qualifications

  • all applicants must be eligible for licensure with the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Nova Scotia (CPSNS)
  • coverage with the Canadian Medical Protective Association (CMPA), or proof of alternative coverage
  • Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support (ACLS)
  • Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS)

Community Details

Yarmouth is located at the southwestern most tip of Nova Scotia serving a population of approximately 60,000 in three counties. Affordable housing is available on stunning ocean and lake-frontage properties. Yarmouth is the recreational, entertainment and shopping hub of the southwest area. There is so much to enjoy about the Southwestern end of Nova Scotia, including a unique and storied Acadian French history and beaches that take your breath away! Yarmouth is also connected to the United States through an international ferry service in the summer months (except for during this current Covid pandemic). Our enviable combination of urban amenities and rural natural beauty offers an excellent quality of life for the people that live here. Nova Scotia offers the medical professional opportunities found in larger cities while maintaining a work-life balance in livable, walkable, and affordable communities.
For more details on living and practicing in Yarmouth, please watch Why Practice in South West Nova Scotia and Edge of Everywhere videos, and visit Town of Yarmouth and Yarmouth and Acadian Shores.

Physicians in Nova Scotia provide fulfilling patient care which embraces family life, professional development and community involvement. That's what makes practicing medicine in Nova Scotia unique. Physicians are increasingly attracted to practices that offer team-based care to their patients and allow them to consult with their peers. The size and scale of Nova Scotia allows for better connections across the health care system. Your practice of medicine and your life is richer here. Nova Scotia is more than medicine.


Nova Scotia Health Authority (NSHA) is committed to being a workforce that is free of discrimination, values diversity and is representative, at all job levels, of the people we serve. Our priority groups are Aboriginal People, African Nova Scotians, Persons with Disabilities and Recent Immigrants. Members of these groups are welcome to apply and self-identify if they wish to be considered under our Employment Equity policy.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Site Name: Montreal Queen Street
Posted Date: Apr 25 2022

ViiV Healthcare is a global specialist HIV company, the only one that is 100% focused on researching and delivering new medicines for people living with, and at risk for, HIV. ViiV Healthcare is highly mission-driven in our unrelenting commitment to being a trusted partner for all people living with and affected by HIV.

Our aim is to think, act, and connect differently through a focus on education on and treatment for HIV. We go to extraordinary lengths to deliver the sorts of breakthroughs, both in treatments, care solutions, and working with communities, that really count. We go beyond the boundaries of medicine by taking a holistic approach to HIV through developing and supporting sustainable community programs and improving access to care. We are fully committed to push through every challenge until HIV/AIDS is eradicated. ViiV Healthcare has played a significant part in delivering breakthroughs that have turned HIV into a manageable health condition. We offer the largest portfolio of HIV medicines available anywhere, and we continue our work to cater for the widest possible range of needs in response to the HIV epidemic. We are aware of how much is at stake for those affected by HIV and we show up every day 100% committed to the people living with HIV.

Our work culture is fast-paced, diverse, inclusive, competitive, and caring. But ViiV Healthcare isn’t just somewhere to work – it’s a place to belong, an invitation to bring your very best, and a team full of impact-driven team members who are hungry to make a difference. For 30 years we have been improving the lives of people living with HIV, and this is an especially exciting time to be at ViiV Healthcare, as we evaluate novel approaches to treatment and prevention that could further reduce the impact of HIV on individuals and communities.

ViiV Healthcare Canada is seeking an experienced, results-driven professional for the position of Administrative Assistant, reporting to General Manager

Key Responsibilities

  • Provides full range support to General Manager. It includes but not limited to supporting the preparation of meetings/ PowerPoint presentation, consolidating pre- reads, preparing meeting agenda, internal town halls, minutes & logistics, arranging meeting schedules and handling expenses claims, etc.
  • Calendar: Provide comprehensive administrative support to the GM managing details of calendar and ad hoc admin. This includes scheduling, arranging, and monitoring calendar appointments and meetings, often requiring an understanding of, and juggling of, priorities.
  • Travel: Co-ordinate extensive domestic & international travel.
  • Admin systems: Be competent in various GSK systems to complete expenses on time, manage invoices and raise purchase orders.
  • Support Leadership Team with contract management, purchase orders, and payment of invoices
  • Maintains/builds team sites (Teams or Share Point), keeps departmental documentation up to date and proposes ideas on how to best ensure document and knowledge management.
  • Acts as the key point of contact for onboarding new hires.
  • Projects: Additional projects may be agreed upon, including meeting preparation, supporting the running of meetings, major special events, culture, and engagement activities, etc. – depending on current business needs.

Basic Qualifications

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:

  • Bilingual (English & French)
  • Exercises judgment and acts independently while handling administrative details
  • Demonstrable experience providing varied administrative support of increasing complexity at Director level or above (this includes management of complex calendars, travel, expenses etc)
  • Expert level of proficiency in a broad range of computer skills necessary to support a senior leader Excel, Outlook, etc.)
  • A high degree of accountability, integrity, and discretion when dealing with confidential matters
  • Adopts a highly flexible approach to work and can triage competing priorities to manage a high-volume workload proactively to a consistently high standard, by setting priorities, objectives, and target dates
  • Demonstrates a high level of proficiency in interpersonal and communicational skills with the ability to interact in a highly professional manner.
  • Excellent organizational skills with high attention to detail, including the ability to handle complex travel arrangements and organize multi-site events
  • Team player with the ability to collaborate with various departments globally and gain the confidence and cooperation of peers.
  • Demonstrates flexibility to adjust to the ever-changing needs of the position, working with people at all levels, internal and external, with adaptability to working styles

Preferred Qualifications

If you have the following qualifications, it would be a plus:

  • Pharmaceutical industry experience
  • Expert level of proficiency in a broad range of computer skills necessary to support a senior leader i.e., SAP & Ariba

  • LI-GSK

ViiV is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. ViiV is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, ViiV is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

ViiV does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact ViiV 's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to ViiV. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and ViiV. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of ViiV. ViiV shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Oral Care Field Consultant, Consumer Healthcare - Oakville,...
description:
Site Name: Canada - Ontario - Mississauga
Posted Date: Apr 1 2022


** The candidate would preferably be located in Oakville, Burlington or surrounds. **

Job Purpose:

GSK Consumer Healthcare is one of the world's largest consumer healthcare companies. Our purpose is to help more people around the world to do more, feel better and live longer with everyday healthcare products. We have a heritage that goes back over 160 years. We own some of the world's best loved healthcare brands, including Sensodyne®, Pronamel®, biotène®, Polident®, Voltaren®, Buckley’s®, TUMS®, NeoCitran® and Otrivin®.

Our goal is to build a global, growing business we call a Fast Moving Consumer Healthcare company, dedicated to everyday healthcare with all of the scientific expertise and quality guarantees that demands, working at the speed and with the genuine consumer understanding the modern world expects.

We are recruiting for a dynamic individual to join our Expert Sales team in the Oral Care division in Calgary.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Effectively develop and implement territory business plans and individual customer call plans aimed to grow the Calgary area business.
  • Set appropriate short-term objectives in order to achieve/surpass the annual objectives of the territory and Oral Care division.
  • Identify opportunities for growth within the territory through grassroots research, networking and strategic partnerships.
  • Thoroughly understand GSK products, strategies, positioning and POA, as well as those of key competitors.
  • Use conversational, patient-focused selling techniques. Effectively integrate strong GSK product knowledge into engaging dialogue, to provide customers an insightful, and differentiated perspective of GSK products.
  • Proactively collaborate with colleagues across the organization to continually improve, and successfully execute territory business plans.
  • Allocate budget and effectively use available resources to create customer and business value.

Qualifications Required:

  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree – Science or Business preferred, or Licensed Dental Professional
  • Previous sales experience in any organization is an asset (1-3 years minimum
    • Valid driver’s license
  • Working knowledge of computer technology, Word, Excel, PPT and agility to learn new programs
  • Willingness to travel. May include overnight and/or weekend travel up to 10%
  • You are self-motivated, and able to work independently.
  • You ensure your work contributes to the goals of the business and use your sound judgment to influence decisions.
  • You find the best solutions for the business by working with people both inside and outside the organization. You work collaboratively with others and develop effective relationships to create new ideas together to get the best results.
  • You contribute to a great working environment by bringing energy and commitment.
  • You are open to learning, adapting quickly to new ways of working and identifying opportunities for development.
  • Preferred for candidates to be living in Oakville, Burlington or surrounds.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • High sense of initiative with a passionate, entrepreneurial spirit.
  • Well-developed verbal and written communication skills to communicate with structure and clarity.
  • Strong listening skills to help strategically engage and influence health care professionals, as well as internal partners.
  • High learning agility and strong business acumen.
  • Presentation skills – ability to lead sessions with large groups.
  • Ability to interpret scientific research studies, and in-depth knowledge of data analysis techniques.

  • This position requires the employee to drive routinely on Company business and allows for the provision of a company – leased vehicle. However, to be eligible for this position and a company vehicle, GSK will need to obtain acceptable results from a license verification inquiry and drivers abstract review against its safe driver program requirements

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: newSales Strategy Manager, Consumer Healthcare
description:
Site Name: Canada - Ontario - Mississauga
Posted Date: May 2 2022


Job Purpose

Reporting directly to the Sales Strategy NRM Lead, the Sales Strategy Manager plays a central role in the delivery of GSK’s net sales strategic growth plan for their assigned portfolio, by brand. Primary accountabilities include leading the development of channel & customer in-market strategies, creating selling tools that strengthen our Sales go-to-market capability, planning efficiency, and customer effectiveness. This role also influences retail execution to ensure our brand and customer strategies are effectively implemented in-store with the desired shopper impact. The role works collaboratively across all functions to ensure we are planning our business to meet the evolving needs and timelines of our customer partners, and executing our in-market plans with excellence as measured against predefined goals. The role inspires cross-functional collaboration and partnership. This Sales Strategy role provides the ideal candidate the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, dynamic, and energized work environment where both performance and personal development matter

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Under the guidance of the Sales Strategy & NRM Lead, and working seamlessly with Customer Sales Teams and Brand Marketing:

Clearly Define Trade Strategies

  • Develop the annual sales plans for assigned brands; establish and measure against goals

  • Deliver insight-based assortment, promotion, shelf & pricing guidance toolkits

  • Develop new product sales plans/priorities to support varying customer & channel models (EDLP, Hi-Lo, E-Commerce)

  • Translate brand & category strategies into channel and compelling, shopper-based customer strategic selling propositions

  • Develop and standardize persuasive presentation materials and tools to maximize selling effectiveness

  • Lead appropriate channel & customer differentiation strategies and needs

  • Ensure display strategies/offerings are in line with the strategies

  • Defend with key market strategies against competitive threats


Plan Effectively

  • Incorporate customer & channel strategies into brand long/mid-term category plans

  • Ensure the customer lens is integrated into all new product launch plans. Institutionalize Customer Value Assessment

  • Lead product transition planning to minimize costs & residual, and maximize speed to floor

  • Support national product allocations for assigned brands as required, ensuring minimal in-store availability impact

  • Strengthen link between Sales & Marketing cycles; develop appropriate tools to meet external/internal needs

  • Transform customer Joint Business Planning to world-class, multi-year planning. Ensure key deliverables and timelines are well defined and met

  • Ensure trade margin is not a barrier for growth; identify and lead progress as required

  • Ensure potential customer acceptance and/or execution barriers are identified and overcome in the Sales/Brand planning process


Be the Customer and Portfolio Expert

  • Participate in key Customer sales calls. Be recognized by Customers as the brand & category expert

  • Be recognized as the Retail expert for brand, finance, operations, supply and other departments as required

  • Participate in and lead assigned segments of Customer Joint Business Planning meetings

  • Participate in Customer Sales S&OP process as a contributor for category insights and promotion trends

  • Support Retail Development planning to ensure brand plan priorities are aligned, effectively communicated, and appropriately actioned and measured


Why you?

Basic Qualifications:

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:

  • Bachelor's degree in business or a related field with a minimum of 5 years Tier 1 CPG sales experience

  • Minimum of 2 years Sales Strategy or Sales Planning functional experience

  • Well-developed strategic and critical thinking capabilities, followed by strong execution skills

  • Demonstrated business savvy; confidence to engage at executive levels both internally and externally at customers

  • Strong financial acumen, budget management skills, and proficiency in forecasting knowledge

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Excellent customer relationship skills

  • Passion for collaboration

  • Experience working in the OTC market an asset

  • Advanced knowledge of A.C. Nielsen, IQVIA services data trends interpretation, retail POS data and customer systems

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word & PowerPoint)


Why Consumer Healthcare?


Right now, we’re on an incredible journey as we prepare to become the first independent, 100% focused consumer healthcare company. We’re doing this at a time when the work we do has never mattered more. Better everyday health is about improving the health and wellness of the consumers that we touch every year – over a billion and a half of them – and it goes beyond products. It’s about truly helping people manage their health proactively in different ways as consumer needs evolve.

With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.

This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

In Consumer Healthcare we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.


We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your

authentic self belongs and thrives.

  • LI-GSK

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

As a health and science-based organization, GSK is committed to following the recommendations as set out by Health Canada and taking all necessary steps to help curb the spread of COVID-19 which includes getting the COVID-19 vaccine. We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: newSmall Animal Veterinarian - Emergency Veterinarian
description:
Salary: CAD $95,000 + depending on experience

Package: Competitive salary plus bonus potential, Medical, dental and vision insurance, Generous CE allowance, Professional liability coverage, Membership dues, VIN membership, Outstanding medical and pet supply discounts.

Type of Work: Small Animal Veterinarian - Emergency Veterinarian

Job Details: This practice is seeking a full-time Veterinarian to join their amazing team!

We have a wonderful opportunity located in Newmarket, Ontario. They are currently welcoming 2 Veterinarians to join their team. As a successful candidate, previous emergency experience (including emergency surgery) and the completion of a rotating or ER internship program are highly desirable. Their 24-hour emergency department is a collaborative team supported by their in-hospital team of specialists (anesthesia, avian & exotics, dentistry, dermatology, medicine, and surgery). Their emergency department also receives additional support and mentorship from ECC specialists that they work with directly to support their ER doctors.

The emergency team works on a rotational schedule including weekdays, overnights and weekends. This allows for even distribution of the shifts and an overall improved hospital experience. Their specialists also participate in providing after hours support to their emergency team.

Your passion for medicine and compassion for pets and people is matched with a commitment to your professional development. They appreciate and respect the expertise ER doctors provide to their hospital and will work with their doctors to develop their specific areas of interest. They pride themselves on their team-centered philosophy approach towards patient care and client service.

They are a 12,200 square foot facility operating from a main building (10,000 sq. ft.) and a satellite facility (2,200 sq. ft.) located across the parking lot. They have 3 fully equipped surgical suites including 2 Forcetriad energy units and all the equipment required for minimally invasive surgery. They have a 64 slice CT, and two ultrasound machines (one used by Medicine and the other ER and Anesthesia). They have a spacious (intensive) care unit with multiple options for care levels and separation both within, and outside of this area. They currently have the following services to support our hospital; Anesthesia, Avian and Exotics, Dermatology, Dentistry, Emergency Medicine, Internal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Surgery.

Newmarket is a vibrant community surrounded by countryside just north of Toronto with ready access to numerous cultural activities and metropolitan amenities but with ready access to lakes and rural living. The Greater Toronto Area is known for its vibrant multiculturalism with activities that appeal to all passions; trendy cuisine, theatre, live music, summer festivals and outdoor pursuits such as biking, hiking, boating, riding and so much more! There are several popular vacation regions including Algonquin Park and Muskoka cottage country where lakes, rivers and wild spaces provide even the most ardent adventurer with plenty to explore all year round.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Broad emergency, critical care and medical interests, comfort in managing a wide variety of medical cases
  • Excellent diagnostic and clinical skills
  • Overseeing hospitalized patient care and maintaining standards
  • Dedicated to promoting team-based medicine practices
  • A passion for coaching, mentoring and supporting staff and colleagues
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills
  • Desire to contribute to practice development
  • And a genuine desire to enjoy your daily work

If you are interested in this role and require further information please:

APPLY NOW BELOW.


If this role is not quite right for you but you are looking for a new permanent or temporary position, please see ALL JOBS.

You can also contact us via email on info@thevetservice.com or call +44 (0) 1218 177 864 to speak to your personal area advisor.

TheVetService.com is a global digital vet job platform providing all your career needs in the veterinary industry.

Our Services Include:

Clinical Jobs – Locum and Permanent Opportunities for vets and nurses in the UK, USA, New Zealand, Australia, Canada, Northern Ireland and the Republic Of Ireland.

Commercial Jobs – Industry and commercial roles from sales to technical advisory positions within many corporate and independent businesses active in the veterinary industry. From Pharmaceutical, wholesaler to financial positions your next step in your career is just a click away.

Education - Flexible, Cost Effective Digital Professional Development.

Register today for your free digital portal access and support from one of our expert team on contracts, visas, legislation and payment advice amongst other things.

All conversations are of course confidential.

title: Group Manager, Regulatory Affairs
description:
Site Name: Canada - Ontario - Mississauga
Posted Date: Apr 1 2022


Key Accountabilities/Responsibilities:

  • Oversees the development of regulatory strategies to improve GSK submission approval times, achieve competitive labelling, resolve product related issues and/or ensure continued supply for products within the Therapy Area or projects within specialization area.
  • Provides strategic oversight to ensure that clinical trial plans optimize commercial needs and regulatory approval.
  • Builds relationships and trust with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders to support the needs of the business.
  • Contributes to the development and implementation of strategic plans.
  • Provides coaching, direction and oversight to Therapy Area and/or CMC staff to ensure adequate capabilities to deliver objectives, as well as maintain well-motivated, engaged and resilient team.
  • Supports the development of staff and builds a talent pipeline.
  • Manages project prioritization and resource allocation for Therapy Area and/or CMC functions.
  • Leads change and delivers results in the most effective way possible.
  • Develops strategies to maximize and drive efficiencies and increase compliance in regulatory processes.
  • Ensures optimal use of global regulatory support functions.
  • Ensures compliance with applicable Health Canada, industry & GSK codes and guidelines in alignment with business needs.

Qualifications Required:

  • B.Sc. in life science or relevant scientific field (e.g. pharmacology, toxicology, chemistry)
  • Extensive experience in Regulatory Affairs
  • Excellent applied scientific knowledge & skills
  • Must possess a sound understanding of the Canadian Food & Drug Regulations, relevant guidelines and policies
  • Working knowledge of global regulatory agencies and their practices
  • Must possess a thorough understanding of the drug development and commercialization process
  • Highly innovative, creative problem solver and decision maker, who can apply continuous improvement techniques to gain efficiencies in submission preparation and product approval process
  • Strong ability to apply and leverage scientific knowledge for commercial value. Must work as a strategic partner with cross-functional teams.
  • Strong business and financial acumen. Strong strategic thinking skills at the therapeutic level
  • Demonstrated business planning ability
  • Active owner and leader of change
  • Strong leadership, team building and people management skills and experience. Demonstrated record in achieving results through others, building teams and developing the overall capability of a unit
  • Excellent communication, influencing and relationship management skills
  • Sound negotiation skills
  • Ability to engage constructively with others and demonstrate a positive mindset. Willingness to welcome open discussions by inviting and encouraging diverse ideas, styles and perspectives
  • Must act with integrity and demonstrate a strong and effective risk management perspective
  • Strong commitment to quality mindset
  • Proactive and seeks to constantly learn and develop, to ensure that skills meet changing business needs

Preferred Qualifications

  • Graduate degree and/or Post-Graduate Certificate in Regulatory Affairs.
  • Experience in Oncology and/or HIV Therapy Areas

  • LI-GSK

GSK is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals to apply to our career opportunities. GSK is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. If you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies, please contact us at canada-recruitment@gsk.com. Please do not send resumes to this e-mail and instead apply through the online application process of this posting.

We feel strongly that this is the best way to help protect those we value most: our employees, families, communities and the patients and consumers we serve. To that end, we are taking an important step to ensure the safety of our employees during this global public health crisis.

Only employees who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may attend our Mississauga and Laval corporate offices. In addition, all customer-facing employees who, as part of their job, attend healthcare settings such as hospitals, pharmacies, doctors’ offices and dentists’ offices will need to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees may seek an accommodation for human rights-related reasons, including medical or disability-related conditions, or religious beliefs.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

title: Registered Acupuncturist
description:
Doctors Choice Integrative is expanding! We are looking for dedicated healthcare practitioners who are passionate about integrative medicine. Our goal is to provide our patients with an integrated network of health services to best meet their healthcare needs.

We are currently looking for a motivated, energetic, collaborative, and qualified Registered Acupuncturist who is looking to build their practice in the West End of downtown Vancouver. With both half days and full days available, this could be a great fit for you if you are looking to pick-up a second location or to start small and grow!

Our clinic is located in a beautiful and peaceful heritage-style house mere steps from St. Paul's Hospital. Given our location and well-established patient base, we are the perfect location to support the growth of your practice. Our existing practitioners consist of two Naturopathic Doctors, and a Registered Massage Therapist who are equally eager to collaborate with like-minded professionals.

Currently available:

Half or Full Days: Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays

Half Days (mornings): Tuesdays and Thursdays

If interested, please email info[at]doctorschoiceintegrative.com to arrange a time to

meet with our clinic owner, Dr. Martha Reid, ND.

Doctors' Choice Integrative Medicine

www.doctorschoiceintegrative.com

1190 Thurlow St. Vancouver, BC

604-688-1169

@dcimvancouver

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 4-12 per week

COVID-19 considerations:
For the safety of our patients and staff, our clinic has numerous protocols in place and follow all government-issued recommendations.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Vancouver, BC V6E 1X3: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)
